sonnets
william shakespeare
1 fairest creatures desire increase thereby beautys rose might never die riper time decease tender heir might bear memory thou contracted thine bright eyes feedst thy lights flame selfsubstantial fuel making famine abundance lies thy self thy foe thy sweet self cruel thou art worlds fresh ornament herald gaudy spring within thine bud buriest thy content tender churl makst waste niggarding pity world else glutton eat worlds due grave thee
2 forty winters shall besiege thy brow dig deep trenches thy beautys field thy youths proud livery gazed tattered weed small worth held asked thy beauty lies treasure thy lusty days say within thine deep sunken eyes alleating shame thriftless praise much praise deserved thy beautys use thou couldst answer fair child mine shall sum count make old excuse proving beauty succession thine new made thou art old see thy blood warm thou feelst cold
3 look thy glass tell face thou viewest time face form another whose fresh repair thou renewest thou dost beguile world unbless mother fair whose uneared womb disdains tillage thy husbandry fond tomb selflove stop posterity thou art thy mothers glass thee calls back lovely april prime thou windows thine age shalt see despite wrinkles thy golden time thou live remembered die single thine image dies thee
4 unthrifty loveliness dost thou spend upon thy self thy beautys legacy natures bequest gives nothing doth lend frank lends free beauteous niggard dost thou abuse bounteous largess given thee give profitless usurer dost thou use great sum sums yet canst live traffic thy self alone thou thy self thy sweet self dost deceive nature calls thee gone acceptable audit canst thou leave thy unused beauty must tombed thee used lives th executor
5 hours gentle work frame lovely gaze every eye doth dwell play tyrants unfair fairly doth excel neverresting time leads summer hideous winter confounds sap checked frost lusty leaves quite gone beauty oersnowed bareness every summers distillation left liquid prisoner pent walls glass beautys effect beauty bereft remembrance flowers distilled though winter meet leese show substance still lives sweet
6 let winters ragged hand deface thee thy summer ere thou distilled make sweet vial treasure thou place beautys treasure ere selfkilled use forbidden usury happies pay willing loan thats thy self breed another thee ten times happier ten one ten times thy self happier thou art ten thine ten times refigured thee could death thou shouldst depart leaving thee living posterity selfwilled thou art much fair deaths conquest make worms thine heir
7 lo orient gracious light lifts burning head eye doth homage newappearing sight serving looks sacred majesty climbed steepup heavenly hill resembling strong youth middle age yet mortal looks adore beauty still attending golden pilgrimage highmost pitch weary car like feeble age reeleth day eyes fore duteous converted low tract look another way thou thy self outgoing thy noon unlooked diest unless thou get son
8 music hear hearst thou music sadly sweets sweets war joy delights joy lovst thou thou receivst gladly else receivst pleasure thine annoy true concord welltuned sounds unions married offend thine ear sweetly chide thee confounds singleness parts thou shouldst bear mark one string sweet husband another strikes mutual ordering resembling sire child happy mother one one pleasing note sing whose speechless song many seeming one sings thee thou single wilt prove none
9 fear wet widows eye thou consumst thy self single life ah thou issueless shalt hap die world wail thee like makeless wife world thy widow still weep thou form thee hast left behind every private widow well may keep childrens eyes husbands shape mind look unthrift world doth spend shifts place still world enjoys beautys waste hath world end kept unused user destroys love toward others bosom sits murdrous shame commits
10 shame deny thou bearst love thy self art unprovident grant thou wilt thou art beloved many thou none lovst evident thou art possessed murdrous hate gainst thy self thou stickst conspire seeking beauteous roof ruinate repair thy chief desire change thy thought may change mind shall hate fairer lodged gentle love thy presence gracious kind thy self least kindhearted prove make thee another self love beauty still may live thine thee
11 fast thou shalt wane fast thou growst one thine thou departest fresh blood youngly thou bestowst thou mayst call thine thou youth convertest herein lives wisdom beauty increase without folly age cold decay minded times cease threescore year would make world away let nature hath made store harsh featureless rude barrenly perish look best endowed gave thee bounteous gift thou shouldst bounty cherish carved thee seal meant thereby thou shouldst print let copy die
12 count clock tells time see brave day sunk hideous night behold violet past prime sable curls silvered oer white lofty trees see barren leaves erst heat canopy herd summers green girded sheaves borne bier white bristly beard thy beauty question make thou among wastes time must go since sweets beauties forsake die fast see others grow nothing gainst times scythe make defence save breed brave takes thee hence
13 self love longer self live coming end prepare sweet semblance give beauty hold lease find determination self selfs decease sweet issue sweet form bear lets fair house fall decay husbandry honour might uphold stormy gusts winters day barren rage deaths eternal cold none unthrifts dear love know father let son say
14 stars judgement pluck yet methinks astronomy tell good evil luck plagues dearths seasons quality fortune brief minutes tell pointing thunder rain wind say princes shall go well oft predict heaven find thine eyes knowledge derive constant stars read art truth beauty shall together thrive thy self store thou wouldst convert else thee prognosticate thy end truths beautys doom date
15 consider every thing grows holds perfection little moment huge stage presenteth nought shows whereon stars secret influence comment perceive men plants increase cheered checked even selfsame sky vaunt youthful sap height decrease wear brave state memory conceit inconstant stay sets rich youth sight wasteful time debateth decay change day youth sullied night war time love takes engraft new
16 wherefore mightier way make war upon bloody tyrant time fortify self decay means blessed barren rhyme stand top happy hours many maiden gardens yet unset virtuous wish would bear living flowers much liker painted counterfeit lines life life repair times pencil pupil pen neither inward worth outward fair make live self eyes men give away self keeps self still must live drawn sweet skill
17 believe verse time come filled high deserts though yet heaven knows tomb hides life shows half parts could write beauty eyes fresh numbers number graces age come would say poet lies heavenly touches neer touched earthly faces papers yellowed age scorned like old men less truth tongue true rights termed poets rage stretched metre antique song child alive time live twice rhyme
18 shall compare thee summers day thou art lovely temperate rough winds shake darling buds may summers lease hath short date sometime hot eye heaven shines often gold complexion dimmed every fair fair sometime declines chance natures changing course untrimmed thy eternal summer shall fade lose possession fair thou owst shall death brag thou wandrest shade eternal lines time thou growst long men breathe eyes see long lives gives life thee
19 devouring time blunt thou lions paws make earth devour sweet brood pluck keen teeth fierce tigers jaws burn longlived phoenix blood make glad sorry seasons thou fleetst whateer thou wilt swiftfooted time wide world fading sweets forbid thee one heinous crime carve thy hours loves fair brow draw lines thine antique pen thy course untainted allow beautys pattern succeeding men yet thy worst old time despite thy wrong love shall verse ever live young
20 womans face natures hand painted hast thou master mistress passion womans gentle heart acquainted shifting change false womens fashion eye bright less false rolling gilding object whereupon gazeth man hue hues controlling steals mens eyes womens souls amazeth woman wert thou first created till nature wrought thee fell adoting addition thee defeated adding one thing purpose nothing since pricked thee womens pleasure mine thy love thy loves use treasure
21 muse stirred painted beauty verse heaven self ornament doth use every fair fair doth rehearse making couplement proud compare sun moon earth seas rich gems aprils firstborn flowers things rare heavens air huge rondure hems let true love truly write believe love fair mothers child though bright gold candles fixed heavens air let say like hearsay well praise purpose sell
22 glass shall persuade old long youth thou one date thee times furrows behold look death days expiate beauty doth cover thee seemly raiment heart thy breast doth live thine elder thou art therefore love thyself wary self thee bearing thy heart keep chary tender nurse babe faring ill presume thy heart mine slain thou gavst thine give back
23 unperfect actor stage fear put beside part fierce thing replete much rage whose strengths abundance weakens heart fear trust forget say perfect ceremony loves rite mine loves strength seem decay oercharged burthen mine loves might let looks eloquence dumb presagers speaking breast plead love look recompense tongue hath expressed learn read silent love hath writ hear eyes belongs loves fine wit
24 mine eye hath played painter hath stelled thy beautys form table heart body frame wherein tis held perspective best painters art painter must see skill find true image pictured lies bosoms shop hanging still hath windows glazed thine eyes see good turns eyes eyes done mine eyes drawn thy shape thine windows breast wherethrough sun delights peep gaze therein thee yet eyes cunning want grace art draw see know heart
25 let favour stars public honour proud titles boast whilst fortune triumph bars unlooked joy honour great princes favourites fair leaves spread marigold suns eye pride lies buried frown glory die painful warrior famoused fight thousand victories foiled book honour razed quite rest forgot toiled happy love beloved may remove removed
26 lord love vassalage thy merit hath duty strongly knit thee send written embassage witness duty show wit duty great wit poor mine may make seem bare wanting words show hope good conceit thine thy souls thought naked bestow till whatsoever star guides moving points graciously fair aspect puts apparel tattered loving show worthy thy sweet respect may dare boast love thee till show head thou mayst prove
27 weary toil haste bed dear respose limbs travel tired begins journey head work mind bodys works expired thoughts far abide intend zealous pilgrimage thee keep drooping eyelids open wide looking darkness blind see save souls imaginary sight presents thy shadow sightless view like jewel hung ghastly night makes black night beauteous old face new lo thus day limbs night mind thee self quiet find
28 return happy plight debarred benefit rest days oppression eased night day night night day oppressed though enemies eithers reign consent shake hands torture one toil complain far toil still farther thee tell day please thou art bright dost grace clouds blot heaven flatter swartcomplexioned night sparkling stars twire thou gildst even day doth daily draw sorrows longer night doth nightly make griefs length seem stronger
29 disgrace fortune mens eyes alone beweep outcast state trouble deaf heaven bootless cries look upon self curse fate wishing like one rich hope featured like like friends possessed desiring mans art mans scope enjoy contented least yet thoughts self almost despising haply think thee state like lark break day arising sullen earth sings hymns heavens gate thy sweet love remembered wealth brings scorn change state kings
30 sessions sweet silent thought summon remembrance things past sigh lack many thing sought old woes new wail dear times waste drown eye unused flow precious friends hid deaths dateless night weep afresh loves long since cancelled woe moan th expense many vanished sight grieve grievances foregone heavily woe woe tell oer sad account forebemoaned moan new pay paid think thee dear friend losses restored sorrows end
31 thy bosom endeared hearts lacking supposed dead reigns love loves loving parts friends thought buried many holy obsequious tear hath dear religious love stoln mine eye interest dead appear things removed hidden thee lie thou art grave buried love doth live hung trophies lovers gone parts thee give due many thine alone images loved view thee thou hast
32 thou survive wellcontented day churl death bones dust shall cover shalt fortune resurvey poor rude lines thy deceased lover compare bettring time though outstripped every pen reserve love rhyme exceeded height happier men vouchsafe loving thought friends muse grown growing age dearer birth love brought march ranks better equipage since died poets better prove style ill read love
33 full many glorious morning seen flatter mountain tops sovereign eye kissing golden face meadows green gilding pale streams heavenly alchemy anon permit basest clouds ride ugly rack celestial face forlorn world visage hide stealing unseen west disgrace even sun one early morn shine triumphant splendour brow alack one hour mine region cloud hath masked yet love whit disdaineth suns world may stain heavens sun staineth
34 didst thou promise beauteous day make travel forth without cloak let base clouds oertake way hiding thy bravry rotten smoke tis enough cloud thou break dry rain stormbeaten face man well salve speak heals wound cures disgrace thy shame give physic grief though thou repent yet still loss th offenders sorrow lends weak relief bears strong offences cross ah tears pearl thy love sheds rich ransom ill deeds
35 grieved thou hast done roses thorns silver fountains mud clouds eclipses stain moon sun loathsome canker lives sweetest bud men make faults even authorizing thy trespass compare self corrupting salving thy amiss excusing thy sins thy sins thy sensual fault bring sense thy adverse party thy advocate gainst self lawful plea commence civil war love hate accessary needs must sweet thief sourly robs
36 let confess two must twain although undivided loves one shall blots remain without thy help borne alone two loves one respect though lives separable spite though alter loves sole effect yet doth steal sweet hours loves delight may evermore acknowledge thee lest bewailed guilt thee shame thou public kindness honour unless thou take honour thy name love thee sort thou mine mine thy good report
37 decrepit father takes delight see active child deeds youth made lame fortunes dearest spite take comfort thy worth truth whether beauty birth wealth wit entitled thy parts crowned sit make love engrafted store lame poor despised whilst shadow doth substance give thy abundance sufficed part thy glory live look best best wish thee wish ten times happy
38 muse want subject invent thou dost breathe pourst verse thine sweet argument excellent every vulgar paper rehearse give thy self thanks aught worthy perusal stand thy sight whos dumb write thee thou thy self dost give invention light thou tenth muse ten times worth old nine rhymers invocate calls thee let bring forth eternal numbers outlive long date slight muse please curious days pain mine thine shall praise
39 thy worth manners may sing thou art better part mine praise mine self bring ist mine praise thee even let us divided live dear love lose name single one separation may give due thee thou deservst alone absence torment wouldst thou prove thy sour leisure gave sweet leave entertain time thoughts love time thoughts sweetly doth deceive thou teachest make one twain praising doth hence remain
40 take loves love yea take hast thou thou hadst love love thou mayst true love call mine thine thou hadst love thou love receivest blame thee love thou usest yet blamed thou thy self deceivest wilful taste thy self refusest forgive thy robbery gentle thief although thou steal thee poverty yet love knows greater grief bear greater wrong hates known injury lascivious grace ill well shows kill spites yet must foes
41 pretty wrongs liberty commits sometime absent thy heart thy beauty thy years full well befits still temptation follows thou art gentle thou art therefore beauteous thou art therefore assailed woman woos womans son sourly leave till prevailed ay yet thou mightst seat forbear chide thy beauty thy straying youth lead thee riot even thou art forced break twofold truth thy beauty tempting thee thine thy beauty false
42 thou hast grief yet may said loved dearly hath thee wailing chief loss love touches nearly loving offenders thus excuse ye thou dost love thou knowst love sake even doth abuse suffring friend sake approve lose thee loss loves gain losing friend hath found loss find lose twain sake lay cross heres joy friend one sweet flattery loves alone
43 wink mine eyes best see day view things unrespected sleep dreams look thee darkly bright bright dark directed thou whose shadow shadows doth make bright would thy shadows form form happy show clear day thy much clearer light unseeing eyes thy shade shines would say mine eyes blessed made looking thee living day dead night thy fair imperfect shade heavy sleep sightless eyes doth stay days nights see till see thee nights bright days dreams show thee
44 dull substance flesh thought injurious distance stop way despite space would brought limits far remote thou dost stay matter although foot stand upon farthest earth removed thee nimble thought jump sea land soon think place would ah thought kills thought leap large lengths miles thou art gone much earth water wrought must attend times leisure moan receiving nought elements slow heavy tears badges eithers woe
45 two slight air purging fire thee wherever abide first thought desire presentabsent swift motion slide quicker elements gone tender embassy love thee life made four two alone sinks death oppressed melancholy lifes composition recured swift messengers returned thee even come back assured thy fair health recounting told joy longer glad send back straight grow sad
46 mine eye heart mortal war divide conquest thy sight mine eye heart thy pictures sight would bar heart mine eye freedom right heart doth plead thou dost lie closet never pierced crystal eyes defendant doth plea deny says thy fair appearance lies side title impanelled quest thoughts tenants heart verdict determined clear eyes moiety dear hearts part thus mine eyes due thy outward part hearts right thy inward love heart
47 betwixt mine eye heart league took doth good turns unto mine eye famished look heart love sighs doth smother loves picture eye doth feast painted banquet bids heart another time mine eye hearts guest thoughts love doth share part either thy picture love thy self away art present still thou farther thoughts canst move still thee sleep thy picture sight awakes heart hearts eyes delight
48 careful took way trifle truest bars thrust use might unused stay hands falsehood sure wards trust thou jewels trifles worthy comfort greatest grief thou best dearest mine care art left prey every vulgar thief thee locked chest save thou art though feel thou art within gentle closure breast whence pleasure thou mayst come part even thence thou wilt stoln fear truth proves thievish prize dear
49 time ever time come shall see thee frown defects thy love hath cast utmost sum called audit advised respects time thou shalt strangely pass scarcely greet sun thine eye love converted thing shall reasons find settled gravity time ensconce within knowledge mine desert hand self uprear guard lawful reasons thy part leave poor thou hast strength laws since love allege cause
50 heavy journey way seek weary travels end doth teach case repose say thus far miles measured thy friend beast bears tired woe plods dully bear weight instinct wretch know rider loved speed made thee bloody spur provoke sometimes anger thrusts hide heavily answers groan sharp spurring side groan doth put mind grief lies onward joy behind
51 thus love excuse slow offence dull bearer thee speed thou art haste thence till return posting need excuse poor beast find swift extremity seem slow spur though mounted wind winged speed motion shall know horse desire keep pace therefore desire perfectst love made shall neigh dull flesh fiery race love love thus shall excuse jade since thee going went wilfulslow towards thee ill run give leave go
52 rich whose blessed key bring sweet uplocked treasure every hour survey blunting fine point seldom pleasure therefore feasts solemn rare since seldom coming long year set like stones worth thinly placed captain jewels carcanet time keeps chest wardrobe robe doth hide make special instant specialblest new unfolding imprisoned pride blessed whose worthiness gives scope triumph lacked hope
53 substance whereof made millions strange shadows tend since every one hath every one one shade one every shadow lend describe adonis counterfeit poorly imitated helens cheek art beauty set grecian tires painted new speak spring foison year one doth shadow beauty show bounty doth appear every blessed shape know external grace part like none none constant heart
54 much doth beauty beauteous seem sweet ornament truth doth give rose looks fair fairer deem sweet odour doth live canker blooms full deep dye perfumed tincture roses hang thorns play wantonly summers breath masked buds discloses virtue show live unwooed unrespected fade die sweet roses sweet deaths sweetest odours made beauteous lovely youth shall vade verse distills truth
55 marble gilded monuments princes shall outlive powerful rhyme shall shine bright contents unswept stone besmeared sluttish time wasteful war shall statues overturn broils root work masonry mars sword wars quick fire shall burn living record memory gainst death alloblivious enmity shall pace forth praise shall still find room even eyes posterity wear world ending doom till judgment self arise live dwell lovers eyes
56 sweet love renew thy force said thy edge blunter appetite today feeding allayed tomorrow sharpened former might love thou although today thou fill thy hungry eyes even till wink fulness tomorrow see kill spirit love perpetual dulness let sad interim like ocean parts shore two contracted new come daily banks see return love blest may view call winter full care makes summers welcome thrice wished rare
57 slave tend upon hours times desire precious time spend services till require dare chide worldwithoutend hour whilst sovereign watch clock think bitterness absence sour bid servant adieu dare question jealous thought may affairs suppose like sad slave stay think nought save happy make true fool love though thing thinks ill
58 god forbid made first slave thought control times pleasure hand th account hours crave vassal bound stay leisure let suffer beck th imprisoned absence liberty patience tame sufferance bide check without accusing injury list charter strong self may privilage time doth belong self pardon selfdoing crime wait though waiting hell blame pleasure ill well
59 nothing new hath brains beguiled labouring invention bear amis second burthen former child record could backward look even five hundred courses sun show image antique book since mind first character done might see old world could say composed wonder frame whether mended whether better whether revolution sure wits former days subjects worse given admiring praise
60 like waves make towards pebbled shore minutes hasten end changing place goes sequent toil forwards contend nativity main light crawls maturity wherewith crowned crooked eclipses gainst glory fight time gave doth gift confound time doth transfix flourish set youth delves parallels beautys brow feeds rarities natures truth nothing stands scythe mow yet times hope verse shall stand praising thy worth despite cruel hand
61 thy thy image keep open heavy eyelids weary night dost thou desire slumbers broken shadows like thee mock sight thy spirit thou sendst thee far home deeds pry find shames idle hours scope tenure thy jealousy thy love though much great love keeps mine eye awake mine true love doth rest defeat play watchman ever thy sake thee watch whilst thou dost wake elsewhere far others near
62 sin selflove possesseth mine eye soul every part sin remedy grounded inward heart methinks face gracious mine shape true truth account self mine worth define worths surmount glass shows self indeed beated chopt tanned antiquity mine selflove quite contrary read self selfloving iniquity tis thee self self praise painting age beauty thy days
63 love shall times injurious hand crushed oerworn hours drained blood filled brow lines wrinkles youthful morn hath travelled ages steepy night beauties whereof hes king vanishing vanished sight stealing away treasure spring time fortify confounding ages cruel knife shall never cut memory sweet loves beauty though lovers life beauty shall black lines seen shall live still green
64 seen times fell hand defaced richproud cost outworn buried age sometime lofty towers see downrased brass eternal slave mortal rage seen hungry ocean gain advantage kingdom shore firm soil win watery main increasing store loss loss store seen interchange state state self confounded decay ruin hath taught thus ruminate time come take love away thought death choose weep fears lose
65 since brass stone earth boundless sea sad mortality oersways power rage shall beauty hold plea whose action stronger flower shall summers honey breath hold wrackful siege battring days rocks impregnable stout gates steel strong time decays fearful meditation alack shall times best jewel times chest lie hid strong hand hold swift foot back spoil beauty forbid none unless miracle might black ink love may still shine bright
66 tired restful death cry behold desert beggar born needy nothing trimmed jollity purest faith unhappily forsworn gilded honour shamefully misplaced maiden virtue rudely strumpeted right perfection wrongfully disgraced strength limping sway disabled art made tonguetied authority folly doctorlike controlling skill simple truth miscalled simplicity captive good attending captain ill tired would gone save die leave love alone
67 ah wherefore infection live presence grace impiety sin advantage achieve lace self society false painting imitate cheek steal dead seeming living hue poor beauty indirectly seek roses shadow since rose true live nature bankrupt beggared blood blush lively veins hath exchequer proud many lives upon gains stores show wealth days long since last bad
68 thus cheek map days outworn beauty lived died flowers bastard signs fair born durst inhabit living brow golden tresses dead right sepulchres shorn away live second life second head ere beautys dead fleece made another gay holy antique hours seen without ornament self true making summer anothers green robbing old dress beauty new map doth nature store show false art beauty yore
69 parts thee worlds eye doth view want nothing thought hearts mend tongues voice souls give thee due uttering bare truth even foes commend thy outward thus outward praise crowned tongues give thee thine accents praise confound seeing farther eye hath shown look beauty thy mind guess measure thy deeds churls thoughts although eyes kind thy fair flower add rank smell weeds thy odour matcheth thy show soil thou dost common grow
70 thou art blamed shall thy defect slanders mark ever yet fair ornament beauty suspect crow flies heavens sweetest air thou good slander doth approve thy worth greater wooed time canker vice sweetest buds doth love thou presentst pure unstained prime thou hast passed ambush young days either assailed victor charged yet thy praise thy praise tie envy evermore enlarged suspect ill masked thy show thou alone kingdoms hearts shouldst owe
71 longer mourn dead shall hear surly sullen bell give warning world fled vile world vilest worms dwell nay read line remember hand writ love sweet thoughts would forgot thinking make woe say look upon verse perhaps compounded clay much poor name rehearse let love even life decay lest wise world look moan mock gone
72 lest world task recite merit lived love death dear love forget quite nothing worthy prove unless would devise virtuous lie mine desert hang praise upon deceased niggard truth would willingly impart lest true love may seem false love speak well untrue name buried body live shame shamed bring forth love things nothing worth
73 time year thou mayst behold yellow leaves none hang upon boughs shake cold bare ruined choirs late sweet birds sang thou seest twilight day sunset fadeth west black night doth take away deaths second self seals rest thou seest glowing fire ashes youth doth lie deathbed whereon must expire consumed nourished thou perceivst makes thy love strong love well thou must leave ere long
74 contented fell arrest without bail shall carry away life hath line interest memorial still thee shall stay thou reviewest thou dost review part consecrate thee earth earth due spirit thine better part thou hast lost dregs life prey worms body dead coward conquest wretchs knife base thee remembered worth contains thee remains
75 thoughts food life sweetseasoned showers ground peace hold strife twixt miser wealth found proud enjoyer anon doubting filching age steal treasure counting best alone bettered world may see pleasure sometime full feasting sight clean starved look possessing pursuing delight save must took thus pine surfeit day day gluttoning away
76 verse barren new pride far variation quick change time glance aside newfound methods compounds strange write still one ever keep invention noted weed every word doth almost tell name showing birth proceed know sweet love always write love still argument best dressing old words new spending already spent sun daily new old love still telling told
77 thy glass show thee thy beauties wear thy dial thy precious minutes waste vacant leaves thy minds imprint bear book learning mayst thou taste wrinkles thy glass truly show mouthed graves give thee memory thou thy dials shady stealth mayst know times thievish progress eternity look thy memory contain commit waste blanks thou shalt find children nursed delivered thy brain take new acquaintance thy mind offices oft thou wilt look shall profit thee much enrich thy book
78 oft invoked thee muse found fair assistance verse every alien pen hath got use thee poesy disperse thine eyes taught dumb high sing heavy ignorance aloft fly added feathers learneds wing given grace double majesty yet proud compile whose influence thine born thee others works thou dost mend style arts thy sweet graces graced thou art art dost advance high learning rude ignorance
79 whilst alone call upon thy aid verse alone thy gentle grace gracious numbers decayed sick muse doth give place grant sweet love thy lovely argument deserves travail worthier pen yet thee thy poet doth invent robs thee pays thee lends thee virtue stole word thy behaviour beauty doth give found thy cheek afford praise thee thee doth live thank doth say since owes thee thou thy self dost pay
80 faint write knowing better spirit doth use name praise thereof spends might make tonguetied speaking fame since worth wide ocean humble proudest sail doth bear saucy bark inferior far broad main doth wilfully appear shallowest help hold afloat whilst upon soundless deep doth ride wrecked worthless boat tall building goodly pride thrive cast away worst love decay
81 shall live epitaph make survive earth rotten hence memory death take although part forgotten name hence immortal life shall though gone world must die earth yield common grave entombed mens eyes shall lie monument shall gentle verse eyes yet created shall oerread tongues shall rehearse breathers world dead still shall live virtue hath pen breath breathes even mouths men
82 grant thou wert married muse therefore mayst without attaint oerlook dedicated words writers use fair subject blessing every book thou art fair knowledge hue finding thy worth limit past praise therefore art enforced seek anew fresher stamp timebettering days love yet devised strained touches rhetoric lend thou truly fair wert truly sympathized true plain words thy truetelling friend gross painting might better used cheeks need blood thee abused
83 never saw painting need therefore fair painting set found thought found exceed barren tender poets debt therefore slept report self extant well might show far modern quill doth come short speaking worth worth doth grow silence sin impute shall glory dumb impair beauty mute others would give life bring tomb lives life one fair eyes poets praise devise
84 says say rich praise alone whose confine immured store example equal grew lean penury within pen doth dwell subject lends small glory writes tell dignifies story let copy writ making worse nature made clear counterpart shall fame wit making style admired every beauteous blessings add curse fond praise makes praises worse
85 tonguetied muse manners holds still comments praise richly compiled reserve character golden quill precious phrase muses filed think good thoughts whilst write good words like unlettered clerk still cry amen every hymn able spirit affords polished form well refined pen hearing praised say tis tis true praise add something thought whose love though words come hindmost holds rank others breath words respect dumb thoughts speaking effect
86 proud full sail great verse bound prize precious ripe thoughts brain inhearse making tomb womb wherein grew spirit spirits taught write mortal pitch struck dead neither compeers night giving aid verse astonished affable familiar ghost nightly gulls intelligence victors silence boast sick fear thence countenance filled line lacked matter enfeebled mine
87 farewell thou art dear possessing like enough thou knowst thy estimate charter thy worth gives thee releasing bonds thee determinate hold thee thy granting riches deserving cause fair gift wanting patent back swerving thy self thou gavst thy worth knowing thou gavst else mistaking thy great gift upon misprision growing comes home better judgement making thus thee dream doth flatter sleep king waking matter
88 thou shalt disposed set light place merit eye scorn upon thy side self ill fight prove thee virtuous though thou art forsworn mine weakness best acquainted upon thy part set story faults concealed wherein attainted thou losing shalt win much glory gainer bending loving thoughts thee injuries self thee vantage doublevantage love thee belong thy right self bear wrong
89 say thou didst forsake fault comment upon offence speak lameness straight halt thy reasons making defence thou canst love disgrace half ill set form upon desired change ill self disgrace knowing thy acquaintance strangle look strange absent thy walks tongue thy sweet beloved name shall dwell lest much profane wronk haply old acquaintance tell thee self ill vow debate must neer love thou dost hate
90 hate thou wilt ever world bent deeds cross join spite fortune make bow drop afterloss ah heart hath scaped sorrow come rearward conquered woe give windy night rainy morrow linger purposed overthrow thou wilt leave leave last petty griefs done spite onset come shall taste first worst fortunes might strains woe seem woe compared loss thee seem
91 glory birth skill wealth bodys force garments though newfangled ill hawks hounds horse every humour hath adjunct pleasure wherein finds joy rest particulars measure better one general best thy love better high birth richer wealth prouder garments costs delight hawks horses thee mens pride boast wretched alone thou mayst take away wretchcd make
92 thy worst steal thy self away term life thou art assured mine life longer thy love stay depends upon love thine need fear worst wrongs least life hath end see better state belongs thy humour doth depend thou canst vex inconstant mind since life thy revolt doth lie happy title find happy thy love happy die whats blessedfair fears blot thou mayst false yet know
93 shall live supposing thou art true like deceived husband loves face may still seem love though altered new thy looks thy heart place live hatred thine eye therefore know thy change manys looks false hearts history writ moods frowns wrinkles strange heaven thy creation decree thy face sweet love ever dwell whateer thy thoughts thy hearts workings thy looks nothing thence sweetness tell like eves apple doth thy beauty grow thy sweet virtue answer thy show

95 sweet lovely dost thou make shame like canker fragrant rose doth spot beauty thy budding name sweets dost thou thy sins enclose tongue tells story thy days making lascivious comments thy sport dispraise kind praise naming thy name blesses ill report mansion vices got habitation chose thee beautys veil doth cover every blot things turns fair eyes see take heed dear heart large privilege hardest knife illused doth lose edge
96 say thy fault youth wantonness say thy grace youth gentle sport grace faults loved less thou makst faults graces thee resort finger throned queen basest jewel well esteemed errors thee seen truths translated true things deemed many lambs might stern wolf betray like lamb could looks translate many gazers mightst thou lead away thou wouldst use strength thy state love thee sort thou mine mine thy good report
97 like winter hath absence thee pleasure fleeting year freezings felt dark days seen old decembers bareness everywhere yet time removed summers time teeming autumn big rich increase bearing wanton burden prime like widowed wombs lords decease yet abundant issue seemed hope orphans unfathered fruit summer pleasures wait thee thou away birds mute sing tis dull cheer leaves look pale dreading winters near
98 absent spring proudpied april dressed trim hath put spirit youth every thing heavy saturn laughed leaped yet lays birds sweet smell different flowers odour hue could make summers story tell proud lap pluck grew wonder lilys white praise deep vermilion rose sweet figures delight drawn pattern yet seemed winter still away shadow play
99 forward violet thus chide sweet thief whence didst thou steal thy sweet smells loves breath purple pride thy soft check complexion dwells loves veins thou hast grossly dyed lily condemned thy hand buds marjoram stoln thy hair roses fearfully thorns stand one blushing shame another white despair third red white stoln robbery annexed thy breath theft pride growth vengeful canker eat death flowers noted yet none could see sweet colour stoln thee
100 art thou muse thou forgetst long speak gives thee thy might spendst thou thy fury worthless song darkening thy power lend base subjects light return forgetful muse straight redeem gentle numbers time idly spent sing ear doth thy lays esteem gives thy pen skill argument rise resty muse loves sweet face survey time wrinkle graven satire decay make times spoils despised everywhere give love fame faster time wastes life thou preventst scythe crooked knife
101 truant muse shall thy amends thy neglect truth beauty dyed truth beauty love depends dost thou therein dignified make answer muse wilt thou haply say truth needs colour colour fixed beauty pencil beautys truth lay best best never intermixed needs praise wilt thou dumb excuse silence fort lies thee make much outlive gilded tomb praised ages yet thy office muse teach thee make seem long hence shows
102 love strengthened though weak seeming love less though less show appear love merchandized whose rich esteeming owners tongue doth publish every love new spring wont greet lays philomel summers front doth sing stops pipe growth riper days summer less pleasant mournful hymns hush night wild music burthens every bough sweets grown common lose dear delight therefore like sometime hold tongue would dull song
103 alack poverty muse brings forth scope show pride argument bare worth hath added praise beside blame write look glass appears face overgoes blunt invention quite dulling lines disgrace sinful striving mend mar subject well pass verses tend graces gifts tell much verse sit glass shows look

131 thou art tyrannous thou art whose beauties proudly make cruel well thou knowst dear doting heart thou art fairest precious jewel yet good faith say thee behold thy face hath power make love groan say err dare bold although swear self alone sure false swear thousand groans thinking thy face one anothers neck witness bear thy black fairest judgments place nothing art thou black save thy deeds thence slander think proceeds
132 thine eyes love pitying knowing thy heart torment disdain put black loving mourners looking pretty ruth upon pain truly morning sun heaven better becomes grey cheeks east full star ushers even doth half glory sober west two mourning eyes become thy face let well beseem thy heart mourn since mourning doth thee grace suit thy pity like every part swear beauty black foul thy complexion lack

enter duke frederick lords
rosalind let love love look comes duke celia eyes full anger frederick mistress dispatch safest haste get court rosalind uncle frederick cousin within ten days thou beest found near public court twenty miles thou diest rosalind beseech grace let knowledge fault bear hold intelligence acquaintance mine desires dream frantic trust dear uncle never much thought unborn offend highness frederick thus traitors purgation consist words innocent grace let suffice thee trust thee rosalind yet mistrust make traitor tell whereon likelihood depends frederick thou art thy fathers daughter theres enough rosalind highness took dukedom highness banishd treason inherited lord derive friends whats father traitor good liege mistake much think poverty treacherous celia dear sovereign hear speak junos swans still went coupled inseparable frederick subtle thee smoothness silence patience speak people pity thou art fool robs thee thy name thou wilt show bright seem virtuous gone open thy lips firm irrevocable doom passd upon banishd celia pronounce sentence liege live company frederick fool niece provide outstay time upon mine honour greatness word die exeunt duke lords celia poor rosalind whither wilt thou go wilt thou change fathers give thee mine charge thee thou grievd rosalind cause celia thou hast cousin prithee cheerful knowst thou duke hath banishd daughter rosalind hath celia hath rosalind lacks love teacheth thee thou one shall sundred shall part sweet girl let father seek another heir therefore devise may fly whither go bear us seek take charge upon bear griefs leave heaven sorrows pale say thou canst ill go along thee rosalind whither shall go celia seek uncle forest arden rosalind alas danger us maids travel forth far beauty provoketh thieves sooner gold celia scene ii forest
enter jaques lords habit foresters
jaques killed deer lord sir jaques lets present duke like roman conqueror would well set deers horns upon head branch victory song forester purpose lord yes sir jaques sing tis matter tune make noise enough
shall killd deer leather skin horns wear rest shall hear burden sing home
take thou scorn wear horn crest ere thou wast born thy fathers father wore thy father bore horn horn lusty horn thing laugh scorn exeunt

act scene 1
hall dukes palace
enter duke ephesus aegeon merchant syracuse gaoler officers attendants
aegeon proceed solinus procure fall doom death end woes duke merchant syracuse plead partial infringe laws enmity discord late sprung rancorous outrage duke merchants welldealing countrymen wanting guilders redeem lives seald rigorous statutes bloods excludes pity threatning looks since mortal intestine jars twixt thy seditious countrymen us hath solemn synods decreed syracusians admit traffic adverse towns nay born ephesus seen syracusian marts fairs syracusian born come bay ephesushe dies goods confiscate dukes dispose unless thousand marks levied quit penalty ransom thy substance valued highest rate amount unto hundred marks therefore law thou art condemnd die aegeon yet comfort words done woes end likewise evening sun duke well syracusian say brief cause thou departedst thy native home cause thou camst ephesus aegeon heavier task could imposd speak griefs unspeakable yet world may witness end wrought nature vile offence ill utter sorrow gives leave syracuse born wed unto woman happy hap bad livd joy wealth increasd prosperous voyages often made epidamnum till factors death great care goods random left drew kind embracements spouse absence six months old almost fainting pleasing punishment women bear made provision following soon safe arrived long became joyful mother two goodly sons strange one like could disdnguishd names hour selfsame inn mean woman delivered burden male twins alike parents exceeding poor bought brought attend sons wife meanly proud two boys made daily motions home return unwilling agreed alas soon came aboard league epidamnum saild alwayswindobeying deep gave tragic instance harm longer retain much hope obscured light heavens grant convey unto fearful minds doubtful warrant immediate death though would gladly embracd yet incessant weepings wife weeping saw must come piteous plainings pretty babes mournd fashion ignorant fear forcd seek delays means none sailors sought safety boat left ship sinkingripe us wife careful latterborn fastned unto small spare mast seafaring men provide storms one twins bound whilst like heedful children thus disposd wife fixing eyes care fixd fastned either end mast floating straight obedient stream carried towards corinth thought length sun gazing upon earth dispersd vapours offended us benefit wished light seas waxd calm discovered two ships far making amain us corinth epidaurus ere cameo let say gather sequel went duke nay forward old man break may pity though pardon thee aegeon gods done worthily termd merciless us ere ships could meet twice five leagues encountred mighty rock violently borne upon helpful ship splitted midst unjust divorce us fortune left us alike delight sorrow part poor soul seeming burdened lesser weight lesser woe carried speed wind sight three taken fishermen corinth thought length another ship seizd us knowing hap save gave healthful welcome shipwreckd guests would reft fishers prey bark slow sail therefore homeward bend course thus heard severd bliss misfortunes life prolongd tell sad stories mishaps duke sake thou sorrowest favour dilate full befalln thee till aegeon youngest boy yet eldest care eighteen years became inquisitive brother importund attendantso case like reft brother retaind name might bear company quest whilst laboured love see hazarded loss lovd five summers spent farthest greece roaming clean bounds asia coasting homeward came ephesus hopeless find yet loath leave unsought place harbours men must end story life happy timely death could travels warrant live duke hapless aegeon fates markd bear extremity dire mishap trust laws crown oath dignity princes would may disannul soul sue advocate thee though thou art adjudged death passed sentence may recalld honours great disparagement yet favour thee therefore merchant ill limit thee day seek thy help beneficial hap try friends thou hast ephesus beg thou borrow make sum live thou art doomd die gaoler take thy custody gaoler lord aegeon hopeless helpless doth aegeon wend procrastinate lifeless end exeunt

house antipholus ephesus
enter adriana wife antipholus ephesus luciana sister
adriana neither husband slave returnd haste sent seek master sure luciana two oclock luciana perhaps merchant hath invited mart hes somewhere gone dinner good sister let us dine never fret man master liberty time master see time theyll go come patient sister adriana liberty luciana business still lies door adriana look serve takes ill luciana know bridle adriana theres none asses bridled luciana headstrong liberty lashd woe theres nothing situate heavens eye hath bound earth sea sky beasts fishes winged fowls males subjects controls man divine master lord wide world wild watry seas indud intellectual sense souls preeminence fish fowls masters females lords let attend accords adriana servitude makes keep unwed luciana troubles marriagebed adriana wedded would bear sway luciana ere learn love ill practise obey adriana husband start luciana till come home would forbear adriana patience unmovd marvel though pause meek cause wretched soul bruisd adversity bid quiet hear cry burdned like weight pain much complain thou hast unkind mate grieve thee urging helpless patience would relieve thou live see like right bereft foolbeggd patience thee left luciana well marry one day try comes man husband nigh
adriana say tardy master hand dromio ephesus nay hes two hands two ears witness adriana say didst thou speak knowst thou mind dromio ephesus ay ay told mind upon mine ear beshrew hand scarce could understand luciana spake doubtfully thou couldst feel meaning dromio ephesus nay struck plainly could well feel blows withal doubtfully could scarce understand adriana say prithee coming home seems hath great care please wife dromio ephesus mistress sure master hornmad adriana hornmad thou villain dromio ephesus mean cuckoldmad sure stark mad desird come home dinner askd thousand marks gold tis dinner time quoth gold quoth meat doth burn quoth gold quoth come home quoth gold quoth thousand marks gave thee villain pig quoth burnd gold quoth mistress sir quoth hang thy mistress know thy mistress thy mistress luciana quoth dromio ephesus quoth master know quoth house wife mistress errand due unto tongue thank bare home upon shoulders conclusion beat adriana go back thou slave fetch home dromio ephesus go back new beaten home gods sake send messenger adriana back slave break thy pate across dromio ephesus bless cross beating shall holy head adriana hence prating peasant fetch thy master home dromio ephesus round like football spurn thus spurn hence spurn hither last service must case leather exit luciana fie impatience loureth face adriana company must minions grace whilst home starve merry look hath homely age th alluring beauty took poor cheek hath wasted discourses dull barren wit voluble sharp discourse marrd unkindness blunts marble hard gay vestments affections bait thats fault hes master state ruins found ruind ground defeatures decayed fair sunny look would soon repair unruly deer breaks pale feeds home poor stale luciana selfharming jealousy fie beat hence adriana unfeeling fools wrongs dispense know eye doth homage otherwhere else lets would sister know promisd chain would alone love would detain would keep fair quarter bed see jewel best enamelled lose beauty yet gold bides still others touch often touching gold man hath name falsehood corruption doth shame since beauty please eye ill weep whats left away weeping die luciana many fond fools serve mad jealousy exeunt
mart
antipholus syracuse gold gave dromio laid safe centaur heedful slave wandred forth care seek computation mine hosts report could speak dromio since first sent mart see comes
sir merry humour alterd love strokes jest know centaur receivd gold mistress sent home dinner house phoenix wast thou mad thus madly thou didst answer dromio syracuse answer sir spake word antipholus syracuse even even half hour since dromio syracuse see since sent hence home centaur gold gave antipholus syracuse villain thou didst deny golds receipt toldst mistress dinner hope thou feltst beams jest know aspect fashion demeanour looks beat method sconce dromio syracuse sconce call would leave battering rather head use blows long must get sconce head insconce else shall seek wit shoulders pray sir beaten antipholus syracuse dost thou know dromio syracuse nothing sir beaten antipholus syracuse shall tell dromio syracuse ay sir wherefore say every hath wherefore antipholus syracuse first flouting wherefore urging second time dromio syracuse ever man thus beaten season wherefore neither rhyme reason well sir thank antipholus syracuse thank sir dromio syracuse marry sir something gave nothing antipholus syracuse ill make amends next give nothing something say sir dinnertime dromio syracuse sir think meat wants antipholus syracuse good time sir whats dromio syracuse basting antipholus syracuse well sir twill dry dromio syracuse sir pray eat none antipholus syracuse reason dromio syracuse lest make choleric purchase another dry basting antipholus syracuse well sir learn jest good time theres time things dromio syracuse durst denied choleric antipholus syracuse rule sir dromio syracuse marry sir rule plain plain bald pate father time antipholus syracuse lets hear dromio syracuse theres time man recover hair grows bald nature antipholus syracuse may fine recovery dromio syracuse yes pay fine periwig recover lost hair another man antipholus syracuse time niggard hair plentiful excrement dromio syracuse blessing bestows beasts hath scanted men hair hath given wit antipholus syracuse theres many man hath hair wit dromio syracuse man hath wit lose hair antipholus syracuse thou didst conclude hairy men plain dealers without wit dromio syracuse plainer dealer sooner lost yet loseth kind jollity antipholus syracuse reason dromio syracuse two sound ones fortuneteller needy holloweyd sharplooking wretch living dead man pernicious slave forsooth took conjurer gazing mine eyes feeling pulse face twere outfacing cries possessd together fell upon bound bore thence dark dankish vault home left man bound together till gnawing teeth bonds sunder gaind freedom immediately ran hither grace beseech give ample satisfaction deep shames great indignities angelo lord truth thus far witness dind home lockd duke chain thee angelo lord ran people saw chain neck second merchant besides sworn ears mine heard confess chain first forswore mart thereupon drew sword fled abbey whence think come miracle antipholus ephesus never came within abbey walls ever didst thou draw thy sword never saw chain help heaven false burden withal duke intricate impeach think drunk circes cup housd would mad would plead coldly say dind home goldsmith denies saying sirrah say dromio ephesus sir dind porpentine courtezan finger snatchd ring antipholus ephesus tis true liege ring duke sawst thou enter abbey courtezan sure liege see grace duke strange go call abbess hither think mated stark mad exit one abbess aegeon mighty duke vouchsafe speak word haply see friend save life pay sum may deliver duke speak freely syracusian thou wilt aegeon name sir calld antipholus bondman dromio dromio ephesus within hour bondman sir thank gnawd two cords dromio man unbound aegeon sure remember dromio ephesus remember sir lately bound pinchs patient sir aegeon look strange know well antipholus ephesus never saw life till aegeon grief hath changd since saw last careful hours times deformed hand written strange defeatures face tell yet dost thou know voice antipholus ephesus neither aegeon dromio thou dromio ephesus trust sir aegeon sure thou dost dromio ephesus ay sir sure whatsoever man denies bound believe aegeon know voice times extremity hast thou crackd splitted poor tongue seven short years son knows feeble key untund cares though grained face mine hid sapconsuming winters drizzled snow conduits blood froze yet hath night life memory wasting lamps fading glimmer left dull deaf ears little use hear old witnessesi err tell thou art son antipholus antipholus ephesus never saw father life aegeon seven years since syracuse boy thou knowst parted perhaps son thou shamst acknowledge misery antipholus ephesus duke know city witness neer saw syracuse life duke tell thee syracusian twenty years patron antipholus time neer saw syracuse see thy age dangers make thee dote
reenter abbess antipholus syracuse dromio syracuse
abbess mighty duke behold man much wrongd gather see adriana see two husbands mine eyes deceive duke one men genius natural man spirit deciphers dromio syracuse sir dromio command away dromio ephesus sir dromio pray let stay antipholus syracuse aegeon art thou else dromio syracuse old master hath bound abbess whoever bound loose bonds gain husband liberty speak old aegeon thou best man hadst wife calld aemilia bore thee burden two fair sons thou best aegeon speak speak unto aemilia aegeon dream thou art aemilia thou art tell son floated thee fatal raft abbess men epidamnum twin dromio taken rude fishermen corinth force took dromio son left epidamnum became tell fortune see duke begins morning story right two antipholus two like two dromios one semblance besides urging wreck sea parents children accidentally met together antipholus thou camst corinth first antipholus syracuse sir came syracuse duke stay stand apart know antipholus ephesus came corinth gracious lord dromio ephesus antipholus ephesus brought town famous warrior duke menaphon renowned uncle adriana two dine today antipholus syracuse gentle mistress adriana husband antipholus ephesus say nay antipholus syracuse yet call fair gentlewoman sister call brother luciana told hope shall leisure make good dream see hear angelo chain sir antipholus syracuse think sir deny antipholus ephesus sir chain arrested angelo think sir deny adriana sent money sir bail dromio think brought dromio ephesus none antipholus syracuse purse ducats receivd dromio man bring see still meet others man taen thereupon errors arose antipholus ephesus ducats pawn father duke shall need thy father hath life courtezan sir must diamond antipholus ephesus take much thanks good cheer abbess renowned duke vouchsafe take pains go us abbey hear large discoursed fortunes assembled place sympathized one days error sufferd wrong go keep us company shall make full satisfaction thirtythree years gone travail sons till present hour heavy burden neer delivered duke husband children calendars nativity go gossips feast go long grief nativity duke heart ill gossip feast exeunt antipholus syracuse antipholus ephesus dromio syracuse dromio ephesus dromio syracuse master shall fetch stuff shipboard antipholus ephesus dromio stuff mine hast thou embarkd dromio syracuse goods lay host sir centaur antipholus syracuse speaks master dromio come go us well look anon embrace thy brother rejoice exeunt antipholus syracuse antipholus ephesus dromio syracuse fat friend masters house kitchend today dinner shall sister wife dromio ephesus methinks glass brother see sweetfacd youth walk see gossiping dromio syracuse sir elder dromio ephesus thats question shall try dromio syracuse well draw cuts senior till lead thou first dromio ephesus nay thus came world like brother brother lets go hand hand one another exeunt
end

coriolanus come leave tears brief farewell beast many heads butts away nay mother ancient courage usd say extremities trier spirits common chances common men could bear sea calm boats alike showd mastership floating fortunes blows struck home gentle wounded craves noble cunning usd load precepts would make invincible heart connd virgilia heavens heavens coriolanus nay prithee woman volumnia red pestilence strike trades rome occupations perish coriolanus shall lovd lackd nay mother resume spirit wont say wife hercules six labours youd done savd husband much sweat cominius droop adieu farewell wife mother ill well yet thou old true menenius thy tears salter younger mans venomous thine eyes sometime general seen thee stern thou hast oft beheld hearthardning spectacles tell sad women tis fond wail inevitable strokes tis laugh em mother wot well hazards still solace believet lightly though go alone like lonely dragon fen makes feard talkd seen son exceed common caught cautelous baits practice volumnia first son whither wilt thou go take good cominius thee awhile determine course wild exposture chance starts th way thee virgilia gods cominius ill follow thee month devise thou shalt rest thou mayst hear us thee time thrust forth cause thy repeal shall send oer vast world seek single man lose advantage doth ever cool th absence needer coriolanus fare ye well thou hast years upon thee thou art full wars surfeits go rove one thats yet unbruisd bring gate come sweet wife dearest mother friends noble touch forth bid farewell smile pray come remain ground shall hear still never aught like formerly menenius thats worthily ear hear come lets weep could shake one seven years old arms legs good gods id thee every foot coriolanus give thy hand come exeunt
scene ii rome street near gate
enter two tribunes sicinius brutus aedile
sicinius bid home hes gone well nobility vexd see sided behalf brutus shown power let us seem humbler done adoing sicinius bid home say great enemy gone stand ancient strength brutus dismiss home exit aedile comes mother
sicinius lets meet brutus sicinius say shes mad brutus taen note us keep way volumnia yare well met th hoarded plague th gods requite love menenius peace peace loud volumnia could weeping hear nay shall hear brutus gone virgilia sicinius shall stay would power say husband sicinius mankind volumnia ay fool shame note fool man father hadst thou foxship banish struck blows rome thou hast spoken words sicinius blessed heavens volumnia moe noble blows ever thou wise words romes good ill tell thee yet go nay thou shalt stay would son arabia thy tribe good sword hand sicinius virgilia hed make end thy posterity volumnia bastards good man wounds bear rome menenius come come peace sicinius would continued country began unknit noble knot made brutus would volumnia would twas incensd rabble cats judge fitly worth mysteries heaven earth know brutus pray lets go volumnia pray sir get gone done brave deed ere go hear far doth capitol exceed meanest house rome far son ladys husband see banishd exceed brutus well well well leave sicinius stay baited one wants wits exeunt tribunes volumnia take prayers would gods nothing else confirm curses could meet em day would unclog heart lies heavy tot menenius told home troth cause youll sup volumnia angers meat sup upon shall starve feeding come lets go leave faint puling lament anger junolike come come come exeunt volumnia virgilia menenius fie fie fie exit

enter coriolanus mean apparel disguisd muffled

enter third servingman first meets
third servant fellows first servant strange one ever lookd get th house prithee call master third servant fellow pray avoid house coriolanus let stand hurt hearth third servant coriolanus gentleman third servant marvllous poor one coriolanus true third servant pray poor gentleman take station heres place pray avoid come coriolanus follow function go batten cold bits pushes away third servant prithee tell master strange guest second servant shall exit third servant dwellst thou coriolanus canopy third servant canopy coriolanus ay third servant wheres coriolanus th city kites crows third servant th city kites crows ass thou dwellst daws coriolanus serve thy master third servant sir meddle master coriolanus ay tis honester service meddle thy mistress thou pratst pratst serve thy trencher hence beats away
enter aufidius second servingman
aufidius fellow second servant sir id beaten like dog disturbing lords within aufidius whence comst thou wouldst thou thy name speakst speak man whats thy name coriolanus unmuffling tullus yet thou knowst seeing dost think man necessity commands name aufidius thy name coriolanus name unmusical volscians ears harsh sound thine aufidius say whats thy name thou grim appearance thy face bears command int though thy tackles torn thou showst noble vessel whats thy name coriolanus prepare thy brow frown knowst thou yet aufidius know thee thy name coriolanus name caius marcius hath done thee particularly volsces great hurt mischief thereto witness may surname coriolanus painful service extreme dangers drops blood shed thankless country requited surname good memory witness malice displeasure thou shouldst bear name remains cruelty envy people permitted dastard nobles forsook hath devourd rest sufferd th voice slaves whoopd rome extremity hath brought thy hearth hope mistake save life feard death men th world would voided thee mere spite full quit banishers stand thee thou hast heart wreak thee wilt revenge thine particular wrongs stop maims shame seen thy country speed thee straight make misery serve thy turn use revengeful services may prove benefits thee fight cankred country spleen fiends thou darst prove fortunes thart tird word also longer live weary present throat thee thy ancient malice cut would show thee fool since ever followed thee hate drawn tuns blood thy countrys breast live thy shame unless thee service aufidius marcius marcius word thou hast spoke hath weeded heart root ancient envy jupiter yond cloud speak divine things say tis true id believe thee noble marcius let twine mine arms body grained ash hundred times hath broke scarrd moon splinters clip anvil sword contest hotly nobly thy love ever ambitious strength contend thy valour know thou first lovd maid married never man sighd truer breath see thee thou noble thing dances rapt heart first wedded mistress saw bestride threshold thou mars tell power foot purpose hew thy target thy brawn lose mine arm fort thou hast beat twelve several times nightly since dreamt encounters twixt thyself together sleep unbuckling helms fisting others throat wakd half dead nothing worthy marcius quarrel else rome thou art thence banishd would muster twelve seventy pouring war bowels ungrateful rome like bold flood oerbeat come go take friendly senators th hands taking leaves prepard territories though rome coriolanus bless gods aufidius therefore absolute sir thou wilt leading thine revenges take th one half commission set best thou art experiencd since thou knowst thy countrys strength weakness thine ways whether knock gates rome rudely visit parts remote fright ere destroy come let commend thee first shall say yea thy desires thousand welcomes friend eer enemy yet marcius much hand welcome exeunt coriolanus aufidius

knew kin virgilia lord husband coriolanus eyes wore rome virgilia sorrow delivers us thus changd makes think coriolanus like dull actor forgot part even full disgrace best flesh forgive tyranny say forgive romans kiss long exile sweet revenge jealous queen heaven kiss carried thee dear true lip hath virgind eer since gods prate noble mother world leave unsaluted sink knee th earth kneels thy deep duty impression show common sons volumnia stand blest whilst softer cushion flint kneel thee unproperly show duty mistaken child parent kneels coriolanus whats knees corrected son let pebbles hungry beach fillip stars let mutinous winds strike proud cedars gainst fiery sun murdring impossibility make slight work volumnia thou art warrior holp frame thee know lady coriolanus noble sister publicola moon rome chaste icicle thats curdied frost purest snow hangs dians temple dear valeria volumnia poor epitome th interpretation full time may show like coriolanus god soldiers consent supreme jove inform thy thoughts nobleness thou mayst prove shame unvulnerable stick th wars like great seamark standing every flaw saving eye thee volumnia knee sirrah coriolanus thats brave boy volumnia even wife lady suitors coriolanus beseech peace youd ask remember thing forsworn grant may never held denials bid dismiss soldiers capitulate romes mechanics tell wherein seem unnatural desire tallay rages revenges colder reasons volumnia said grant us thing nothing else ask deny already yet ask fail request blame may hang upon hardness therefore hear us coriolanus aufidius volsces mark well hear nought rome private request volumnia silent speak raiment state bodies would bewray life led since thy exile think thyself unfortunate living women come hither since thy sight make eyes flow joy hearts dance comforts constrains weep shake fear sorrow making mother wife child see son husband father tearing countrys bowels poor thine enmitys capital thou barst us prayers gods comfort enjoy alas country pray whereto bound together thy victory whereto bound alack must lose country dear nurse else thy person comfort country must find evident calamity though wish side win either thou must foreign recreant led manacles streets else triumphantly tread thy countrys ruin bear palm bravely shed thy wife childrens blood son purpose wait fortune till wars determine persuade thee rather show noble grace parts seek end one thou shalt sooner march assault thy country tread trust tot thou shalt thy mothers womb brought thee world virgilia ay mine brought forth boy keep name living time boy shall tread ill run away till bigger ill fight coriolanus womans tenderness requires child womans face see sat long rising volumnia nay go us thus request tend save romans thereby destroy volsces serve might condemn us poisonous honour suit reconcile volsces may say mercy showd romans receivd either side give allhail thee cry blest making peace thou knowst great son end wars uncertain certain thou conquer rome benefit thou shalt thereby reap name whose repetition doggd curses whose chronicle thus writ man noble last attempt wipd destroyd country name remains th ensuing age abhorrd speak son thou hast affected fine strains honour imitate graces gods tear thunder wide cheeks th air yet charge thy sulphur bolt rive oak dost speak thinkst thou honourable noble man still remember wrongs daughter speak cares weeping speak thou boy perhaps thy childishness move reasons theres man world bound tos mother yet lets prate like one th stocks thou hast never thy life showd thy dear mother courtesy poor hen fond second brood cluckd thee wars safely home loaden honour say requests unjust spurn back thou art honest gods plague thee thou restrainst duty mothers part belongs turns away ladies let us shame knees surname coriolanus longs pride pity prayers end last home rome die among neighbours nay beholds boy tell would kneels holds hands fellowship reason petition strength thou hast denyt come let us go fellow volscian mother wife corioli child like chance yet give us dispatch hushd city afire ill speak little holds hand silent coriolanus mother mother done behold heavens ope gods look unnatural scene laugh mother mother happy victory rome son believe believe dangerously prevaild mortal let come aufidius though make true wars ill frame convenient peace good aufidius enter three four conspirators aufidius faction
welcome first conspirator general aufidius even man alms empoisond charity slain second conspirator noble sir hold intent wherein wishd us parties well deliver great danger aufidius sir tell must proceed find people third conspirator people remain uncertain whilst twixt theres difference fall either makes survivor heir aufidius know pretext strike admits good construction raisd pawnd mine honour truth heightend watered new plants dews flattery seducing friends end bowd nature never known rough unswayable free third conspirator sir stoutness stand consul lost lack stooping aufidius would spoken banishd fort came unto hearth presented knife throat took made jointservant gave way desires nay let choose files projects accomplish best freshest men servd designments mine person holp reap fame end took pride wrong till last seemd follower partner wagd countenance mercenary first conspirator lord army marvelld last carried rome lookd less spoil glory aufidius sinews shall stretchd upon drops womens rheum cheap lies sold blood labour great action therefore shall die ill renew fall hark drums trumpets sound great shouts people first conspirator native town enterd like post welcomes home returns splitting air noise second conspirator patient fools whose children hath slain base throats tear giving glory third conspirator therefore vantage ere express move people would say let feel sword second lies along way tale pronouncd shall bury reasons body aufidius say come lords

enter coriolanus marching drum colours commoners
coriolanus hail lords returnd soldier infected countrys love parted hence still subsisting great command know prosperously attempted bloody passage led wars even gates rome spoils brought home doth counterpoise full third part charges action made peace less honour antiates shame th romans deliver subscribd th consuls patricians together seal th senate compounded aufidius read noble lords tell traitor highest degree hath abusd powers coriolanus traitor aufidius ay traitor marcius coriolanus marcius aufidius ay marcius caius marcius dost thou think ill grace thee robbery thy stoln name coriolanus corioli lords heads th state perfidiously betrayd business given certain drops salt city rome say city wife mother breaking oath resolution like twist rotten silk never admitting counsel th war nurses tears whind roard away victory pages blushd men heart lookd wondring others coriolanus hearst thou mars aufidius name god thou boy tears coriolanus ha aufidius coriolanus measureless liar thou hast made heart great contains boy slave pardon lords tis first time ever forcd scold judgments grave lords must give cur lie notion wears stripes impressd upon must bear beating grave shall join thrust lie unto first lord peace hear speak coriolanus cut pieces volsces men lads stain edges boy false hound writ annals true tis like eagle dovecote flutterd volscians corioli alone boy aufidius noble lords put mind blind fortune shame unholy braggart fore eyes ears conspirators let die fort people tear pieces presently killd son daughter killd cousin marcus killd father second lord peace ho outrage peace man noble fame folds orb th earth last offences us shall judicious hearing stand aufidius trouble peace coriolanus six aufidiuses tribe use lawful sword aufidius insolent villain conspirators kill kill kill kill kill conspirators draw kill coriolanuswho falls aufidius stands lords hold hold hold hold aufidius noble masters hear speak first lord tullus second lord thou hast done deed whereat valour weep third lord tread upon masters quiet put swords aufidius lords shall know rage provokd great danger mans life owe youll rejoice thus cut please honours call senate ill deliver loyal servant endure heaviest censure first lord bear hence body mourn let regarded noble corse ever herald follow um second lord impatience takes aufidius great part blame lets make best aufidius rage gone struck sorrow take help three th chiefest soldiers ill one beat thou drum speak mournfully trail steel pikes though city hath widowed unchilded many one hour bewail injury yet shall noble memory assist exeunt bearing body coriolanus dead march sounded

scene britain italy
act scene britain garden cymbelines palace
first gentleman meet man frowns bloods obey heavens courtiers still seem kings second gentleman whats matter first gentleman daughter heir ofs kingdom purposd wifes sole son widow late married hath referrd unto poor worthy gentleman shes wedded husband banishd imprisond outward sorrow though think king touchd heart second gentleman none king first gentleman hath lost queen desird match courtier although wear faces bent kings looks hath heart glad thing scowl second gentleman first gentleman hath missd princess thing bad bad report hath mean married alack good man therefore banishd creature seek regions earth one like would something failing compare think fair outward stuff within endows man second gentleman speak far first gentleman extend sir within crush together rather unfold measure duly second gentleman whats name birth first gentleman delve root father calld sicilius join honour romans cassibelan titles tenantius servd glory admird success gaind suraddition leonatus besides gentleman question two sons wars th time died swords hand father old fond issue took sorrow quit gentle lady big gentleman theme deceasd born king takes babe protection calls posthumus leonatus breeds makes bedchamber puts learnings time could make receiver took air fast twas ministred ins spring became harvest livd court rare praisd lovd sample youngest th mature glass feated graver child guided dotards mistress banishd price proclaims esteemd virtue election may truly read kind man second gentleman honour even report pray tell sole child th king first gentleman child two sons worth hearing mark eldest three years old th swathing clothes nursery stoln hour guess knowledge way went second gentleman long ago first gentleman twenty years second gentleman kings children conveyd slackly guarded search slow could trace first gentleman howsoeer tis strange negligence may well laughd yet true sir second gentleman well believe first gentleman must forbear comes gentleman queen princess exeunt
enter queen posthumus imogen
queen assurd shall find daughter slander stepmothers evileyd unto youre prisoner gaoler shall deliver keys lock restraint posthumus soon win th offended king known advocate marry yet fire rage twere good leand unto sentence patience wisdom may inform posthumus please highness hence today queen know peril ill fetch turn garden pitying pangs barrd affections though king hath chargd speak together exit imogen dissembling courtesy fine tyrant tickle wounds dearest husband something fear fathers wrath nothing always reservd holy duty rage must gone shall abide hourly shot angry eyes comforted live jewel world may see posthumus queen mistress lady weep lest give cause suspected tenderness doth become man remain loyalst husband eer plight troth residence rome one philarios father friend known letter thither write queen mine eyes ill drink words send though ink made gall

enter cymbeline lords
posthumus alack king cymbeline thou basest thing avoid hence sight command thou fraught court thy unworthiness thou diest away thourt poison blood posthumus gods protect bless good remainders court gone exit imogen pinch death sharp cymbeline disloyal thing shouldst repair youth thou heapst years age imogen beseech sir harm vexation senseless wrath touch rare subdues pangs fears cymbeline past grace obedience imogen past hope despair way past grace cymbeline mightst sole son queen imogen blessed might chose eagle avoid puttock cymbeline thou tookst beggar wouldst made throne seat baseness imogen rather added lustre cymbeline thou vile one imogen sir fault lovd posthumus bred playfellow man worth woman overbuys almost sum pays cymbeline art thou mad imogen almost sir heaven restore would neatherds daughter leonatus neighbour shepherds son
cymbeline thou foolish thing queen together done command away pen queen beseech patience peace dear lady daughter peace sweet sovereign leave us make comfort best advice cymbeline nay let languish drop blood day aged die folly exit lords

scene ii britain public place
enter cloten two lords
first lord sir would advise shift shirt violence action hath made reek sacrifice air comes air comes theres none abroad wholesome vent cloten shirt bloody shift hurt second lord aside faith much patience first lord hurt bodys passable carcass hurt throughfare steel hurt second lord aside steel debt went th back side town cloten villain would stand second lord aside fled forward still toward face first lord stand land enough added gave ground second lord aside many inches oceans puppies cloten would come us second lord aside would till measurd long fool upon ground cloten love fellow refuse second lord aside sin make true election damnd first lord sir told always beauty brain go together shes good sign seen small reflection wit second lord aside shines upon fools lest reflection hurt cloten come ill chamber would hurt done second lord aside wish unless fall ass great hurt cloten youll go us first lord ill attend lordship cloten nay come lets go together second lord well lord exeunt
