imogen would thou grewst unto shores th questionedst every sail write twere paper lost offerd mercy last spake thee pisanio queen queen imogen wavd handkerchief pisanio kissd madam imogen senseless linen happier therein pisanio madam long could make eye care distinguish others keep deck glove hat handkerchief still waving fits stirs ofs mind could best express slow soul saild swift ship imogen thou shouldst made little crow less ere left aftereye pisanio madam imogen would broke mine eyestrings crackd look upon till diminution space pointed sharp needle nay followed till melted smallness gnat air turnd mine eye wept good pisanio shall hear pisanio assurd madam next vantage imogen take leave pretty things say ere could tell would think certain hours thoughts could make swear shes italy betray mine interest honour chargd sixth hour morn noon midnight encounter orisons heaven ere could give parting kiss set betwixt two charming words comes father like tyrannous breathing north shakes buds growing

enter cloten two lords

enter imogen bed lady attending
imogen whos woman helen lady please madam imogen hour lady almost midnight madam imogen read three hours mine eyes weak fold leaf left bed take away taper leave burning thou canst awake four th clock prithee call sleep hath seizd wholly exit lady protection commend gods fairies tempters night guard beseech ye sleeps iachimo comes trunk iachimo crickets sing mans oerlabourd sense repairs rest tarquin thus softly press rushes ere wakend chastity wounded cytherea bravely thou becomst thy bed fresh lily whiter sheets might touch kiss one kiss rubies unparagond dearly dot tis breathing perfumes chamber thus flame th taper bows toward would underpeep lids see th enclosed lights canopied windows white azure lacd blue heavens tinct design note chamber write pictures window th adornment bed arras figures contents th story ah natural notes body ten thousand meaner movables would testify enrich mine inventory sleep thou ape death lie dull upon sense monument thus chapel lying come come taking bracelet slippery gordian knot hard tis mine witness outwardly strongly conscience within th madding lord left breast mole cinquespotted like crimson drops th bottom cowslip heres voucher stronger ever law could make secret force think pickd lock taen treasure honour end write thats riveted screwd memory hath reading late tale tereus leafs turnd philomel gave enough th trunk shut spring swift swift dragons night dawning may bare ravens eye lodge fear though heavenly angel hell clock strikes one two three time time exit trunk

act iii scene britain hall cymbelines palace
enter state cymbeline queen cloten lords one door another caius lucius attendants
cymbeline say would augustus caesar us lucius julius caesar whose remembrance yet lives mens eyes ears tongues theme hearing ever britain conquerd cassibelan thine uncle famous caesars praises whit less feats deserving succession granted rome tribute yearly three thousand pounds thee lately left untenderd queen kill marvel shall ever cloten many caesars ere another julius britain world nothing pay wearing noses queen opportunity take resume remember sir liege kings ancestors together natural bravery isle stands neptunes park ribbd pald rocks unscalable roaring waters sands bear enemies boats suck th topmast kind conquest caesar made made brag came saw overcame shame first ever touchd carried coast twice beaten shipping poor ignorant baubles terrible seas like eggshells movd upon surges crackd easily gainst rocks joy whereof famd cassibelan point giglot fortune master caesars sword made luds town rejoicing fires bright britons strut courage cloten come theres tribute paid kingdom stronger time said moe caesars may crookd noses owe straight arms none cymbeline son let mother end cloten yet many among us gripe hard cassibelan say one hand tribute pay tribute caesar hide sun us blanket put moon pocket pay tribute light else sir tribute pray cymbeline must know till injurious romans extort tribute us free caesars ambition swelld much almost stretch sides th world colour put yoke upons shake becomes warlike people reckon cloten cymbeline say caesar ancestor mulmutius ordaind laws whose use sword caesar hath much mangled whose repair franchise shall power hold good deed though rome therefore angry mulmutius made laws first britain put brows within golden crown calld king lucius sorry cymbeline pronounce augustus caesar caesar hath moe kings servants thyself domestic officers thine enemy receive war confusion caesars name pronounce gainst thee look fury resisted thus defied thank thee cymbeline thou art welcome caius thy caesar knighted youth spent much gatherd honour seek perforce behoves keep utterance perfect pannonians dalmatians liberties arms precedent read would show britons cold caesar shall find lucius let proof speak cloten majesty bids welcome make pastime us day two longer seek us afterwards terms shall find us saltwater girdle beat us fall adventure crows shall fare better theres end lucius sir cymbeline know masters pleasure mine remain welcome exeunt

scene iv wales near milford
enter pisanio imogen
imogen thou toldst came horse place near hand neer longd mother see first pisanio man posthumus thy mind makes thee stare thus wherefore breaks sigh th inward thee one painted thus would interpreted thing perplexd beyond selfexplication put thyself haviour less fear ere wildness vanquish staider senses whats matter tenderst thou paper look untender ift summer news smile tot winterly thou needst keep countnance still husbands hand drugdamnd italy hath outcraftied hes hard point speak man thy tongue may take extremity read would even mortal pisanio please read shall find wretched man thing disdaind fortune imogen reads thy mistress pisanio hath playd strumpet bed testimonies whereof lie bleeding speak weak surmises proof strong grief certain expect revenge part thou pisanio must act thy faith tainted breach let thine hands take away life shall give thee opportunity milford hath letter purpose thou fear strike make certain done thou art pander dishonour equally disloyal pisanio shall need draw sword paper hath cut throat already tis slander whose edge sharper sword whose tongue outvenoms worms nile whose breath rides posting winds doth belie corners world kings queens states maids matrons nay secrets grave viperous slander enters cheer madam imogen false bed false lie watch think weep twixt clock clock sleep charge nature break fearful dream cry awake thats false tos bed pisanio alas good lady imogen false thy conscience witness iachimo thou didst accuse incontinency thou lookdst like villain methinks thy favours good enough jay italy whose mother painting hath betrayd poor stale garment fashion richer hang th walls must rippd pieces mens vows womens traitors good seeming thy revolt husband shall thought put villainy born wheret grows worn bait ladies pisanio good madam hear imogen true honest men heard like false aeneas time thought false sinons weeping scandal many holy tear took pity true wretchedness thou posthumus wilt lay leaven proper men goodly gallant shall false perjurd thy great fail come fellow thou honest thou thy masters bidding thou seest little witness obedience look draw sword take hit innocent mansion love heart fear tis empty things grief thy master indeed riches bidding strike thou mayst valiant better cause thou seemst coward pisanio hence vile instrument thou shalt damn hand imogen must die thy hand thou art servant thy masters selfslaughter prohibition divine cravens weak hand come heres heart somethings aforet soft soft well defence obedient scabbard scriptures loyal leonatus turnd heresy away away corrupters faith shall stomachers heart thus may poor fools believe false teachers though betrayd feel treason sharply yet traitor stands worse case woe thou posthumus didst set disobedience gainst king father make put contempt suits princely fellows shalt hereafter find act common passage strain rareness grieve think thou shalt disedgd thou tirest thy memory pangd prithee dispatch lamp entreats butcher wheres thy knife thou art slow thy masters bidding desire pisanio gracious lady since receivd command busines slept one wink imogen dot bed pisanio ill wake mine eyeballs first imogen wherefore didst undertake hast thou abusd many miles pretence place mine action thine horses labour time inviting thee perturbd court absent whereunto never purpose return hast thou gone far unbent thou hast taen thy stand th elected deer thee pisanio win time lose bad employment considerd course good lady hear patience imogen talk thy tongue weary speak heard strumpet mine ear therein false struck take greater wound tent bottom speak pisanio madam thought would back imogen like bringing kill pisanio neither wise honest purpose would prove well master abusd villain ay singular art hath done cursed injury imogen roman courtezan pisanio life ill give notice dead send bloody sign tis commanded shall missd court well confirm imogen good fellow shall bide live life comfort dead husband pisanio youll back th court imogen court father ado harsh noble simple nothing cloten whose lovesuit hath fearful siege pisanio court britain must bide imogen hath britain sun shines day night britain th worlds volume britain seems int great pool swans nest prithee think theres livers britain pisanio glad think place th ambassador lucius roman comes milford tomorrow could wear mind dark fortune disguise appear must yet selfdanger tread course pretty full view yea happily near residence posthumus nigh least though actions visible yet report render hourly ear truly moves imogen means though scene v britain cymbelines palace

mightst made thou diedst rare boy melancholy found arviragus stark see thus smiling fly tickled slumber deaths dart laughd right cheek reposing cushion guiderius arviragus th floor arms thus leagud enter posthumus britain lord

enter prince wales sir john falstaff

prince otter sir john otter fal shes neither fish flesh man knows host thou art unjust man saying thou man knows thou knave thou prince thou sayst true hostess slanders thee grossly host doth lord said day ought thousand pound prince sirrah owe thousand pound fal thousand pound hal million thy love worth million thou owest thy love host nay lord calld jack said would cudgel fal bardolph bard northumberland yea mans brow like titleleaf foretells nature tragic volume looks strand whereon imperious flood hath left witnessd usurpation say morton didst thou come shrewsbury morton ran shrewsbury noble lord hateful death put ugliest mask fright party northumberland doth son brother thou tremblest whiteness thy cheek apter thy tongue tell thy errand even man faint spiritless dull dread look woebegone drew priams curtain dead night would told half troy burnt priam found fire ere tongue percys death ere thou reportst thou wouldst say son thus thus brother thus fought noble douglas stopping greedy ear bold deeds end stop ear indeed thou hast sigh blow away praise ending brother son dead morton douglas living brother yet lord son northumberland dead see ready tongue suspicion hath fears thing would know hath instinct knowledge others eyes feard chanced yet speak morton tell thou earl divination lies take sweet disgrace make thee rich wrong morton great gainsaid spirit true fears certain northumberland yet say percys dead see strange confession thine eye thou shakst thy head holdst fear sin speak truth slain say tongue offends reports death doth sin doth lo comes come hither harry depart chamber leave us alone exeunt king prince prince never thought hear speak king thy wish father harry thought stay long thee weary thee dost thou hunger mine empty chair thou wilt needs invest thee honours thy hour ripe foolish youth thou seekst greatness overwhelm thee stay little cloud dignity held falling weak wind quickly drop day dim thou hast stoln hours thine without offense death thou hast seald expectation thy life manifest thou lovdst thou wilt die assurd thou hidst thousand daggers thy thoughts thou hast whetted thy stony heart stab half hour life canst thou forbear half hour get thee gone dig grave thyself bid merry bells ring thine ear thou art crowned dead let tears bedew hearse drops balm sanctify thy head compound forgotten dust give gave thee life unto worms pluck officers break decrees time come mock form harry fifth crownd vanity royal state sage counsellors hence english court assemble every region apes idleness neighbour confines purge scum ruffian swear drink dance revel night rob murder commit oldest sins newest kind ways happy trouble england shall double gild treble guilt england shall give office honour might fifth harry curbd license plucks muzzle restraint wild dog shall flesh tooth every innocent poor kingdom sick civil blows care could withhold thy riots wilt thou riot thy care thou wilt wilderness peopled wolves thy old inhabitants prince pardon liege tears moist impediments unto speech forestalld dear deep rebuke ere grief spoke heard course far crown wears crown immortally long guard kneeling affect honour renown let obedience rise inward true duteous spirit teacheth prostrate exterior bending god witness came found course breath within majesty cold struck heart feign let present wildness die never live show th incredulous world noble change purposed coming look thinking dead dead almost liege think spake unto crown sense thus upbraided care thee depending hath fed upon body father therefore thou best gold art worst gold less fine carat precious preserving life medcine potable thou fine honourd renownd hast eat thy bearer thus royal liege accusing put head try enemy face murdred father quarrel true inheritor infect blood joy swell thoughts strain pride rebel vain spirit mine least affection welcome give entertainment might let god ever keep head make poorest vassal doth awe terror kneel king son god put thy mind take hence thou mightst win thy fathers love pleading wisely excuse come hither harry sit thou bed hear think latest counsel ever shall breathe god knows son bypaths indirect crookd ways met crown know well troublesome sat upon head thee shall descend better quiet better opinion better confirmation soil achievement goes earth seemd honour snatchd boistrous hand many living upbraid gain assistances daily grew quarrel bloodshed wounding supposed peace bold fears thou seest peril answered reign hath scene acting argument death changes mood purchasd falls upon thee fairer sort thou garland wearst successively yet though thou standst sure could thou art firm enough since griefs green friends thou must make thy friends stings teeth newly taen whose fell working first advancd whose power well might lodge fear displacd avoid cut purpose lead many holy land lest rest lying still might make look near unto state therefore harry thy course busy giddy minds foreign quarrels action hence borne may waste memory former days would lungs wasted strength speech utterly denied came crown god forgive grant may thee true peace live prince gracious liege wore kept gave plain right must possession common pain gainst world rightfully maintain

act v scene gloucestershire shallows house

enter corporal nym lieutenant bardolph

henry doubt since well persuaded carry heart us hence grows fair consent leave one behind doth wish success conquest attend us cambridge never monarch better feard lovd majesty theres think subject sits heartgrief uneasines sweet shade government grey true fathers enemies steepd galls honey serve hearts create duty zeal king henry therefore great cause thankfulness shall forget office hand sooner quittance desert merit according weight worthiness scroop service shall steeled sinews toil labour shall refresh hope grace incessant services king henry judge less uncle exeter enlarge man committed yesterday raild person consider excess wine set advice pardon scroop thats mercy much security let punishd sovereign lest example breed sufferance kind king henry let us yet merciful cambridge may highness yet punish grey sir show great mercy give life taste much correction king henry alas much love care heavy orisons gainst poor wretch little faults proceeding distemper shall winkd shall stretch eye capital crimes chewd swallowd digested appear us well yet enlarge man though cambridge scroop grey dear care tender preservation person would punishd french causes late commissioners cambridge one lord highness bade ask today scroop liege grey royal sovereign king henry richard earl cambridge lord scroop masham sir knight grey northumberland read know know worthiness grey scroop appeal king henry mercy quick us late counsel suppressd killd must dare shame talk mercy reasons turn bosoms dogs upon masters worrying see princes noble peers english monsters lord cambridge know apt love accord furnish appertinents belonging honour man hath light crowns lightly conspird sworn unto practices france kill us hampton knight less bounty bound us cambridge hath likewise sworn shall say thee lord scroop thou cruel ingrateful savage inhuman creature thou didst bear key counsels knewst bottom soul almost mightst coind gold wouldst thou practisd thy use may possible foreign hire could thee extract one spark evil might annoy finger tis strange though truth stands gross black white eye scarcely see treason murder ever kept together two yokedevils sworn eithers purpose working grossly natural cause admiration whoop thou gainst proportion didst bring wonder wait treason murder whatsoever cunning fiend wrought upon thee preposterously hath got voice hell excellence devils suggest treasons botch bungle damnation patches colours forms fetchd glistring semblances piety temperd thee bade thee stand gave thee instance thou shouldst treason unless dub thee name traitor demon hath gulld thee thus lion gait walk whole world might return vasty tartar back tell legions never win soul easy englishmans hast thou jealousy infected sweetness affiance show men dutiful didst thou seem grave learned didst thou come noble family didst thou seem religious didst thou spare diet free gross passion mirth anger constant spirit swerving blood garnishd deckd modest complement working eye without ear purged judgment trusting neither finely bolted didst thou seem thus thy fall hath left kind blot mark fullfraught man best indued suspicion weep thee revolt enter king bedford gloucester

pistol yield cur french soldier je pense que vous etes le gentilhomme de bonne qualite pistol cality calen custure art thou gentleman thy name discuss french soldier seigneur dieu pistol signieur dew gentleman perpend words signieur dew mark signieur dew thou diest point fox except signieur thou give egregious ransom french soldier prenez misericorde ayez pitie de moi pistol moy shall serve forty moys fetch thy rim thy throat drops crimson blood french soldier estil impossible dechapper la force de ton bras pistol brass cur thou damned luxurious mountaingoat offerst brass french soldier pardonnezmoi pistol sayst thou ton moys come hither boy ask slave french name boy ecoutez comment etesvous appele french soldier monsieur le fer boy says name master fer pistol master fer ill fer firk ferret discuss french unto boy know french fer ferret firk pistol bid prepare cut throat french soldier que ditil monsieur boy il commande vous dire que vous faites vous pret car ce soldat ici est dispose tout cette heure de couper votre gorge pistol owy cuppele gorge permafoy peasant unless thou give crowns brave crowns mangled shalt thou sword french soldier je vous supplie pour lamour de dieu pardonner je suis gentilhomme de bonne maison gardez vie et je vous donnerai deux cents ecus pistol words boy prays save life gentleman good house ransom give two hundred crowns pistol tell fury shall abate crowns take french soldier petit monsieur que ditil boy encore quil est contre son jurement de pardonner aucun prisonnier neamnoins pour les ecus que vous lavez promis il est content vous donner la liberte le franchisement french soldier sur mes genoux je vous donne mille remercimens et je mestime heureux que je suis tombe entre les mains dun chevalier je pense le plus brave vaillant lord talbot oerthrown circumstance ill tell large tenth august last dreadful lord retiring siege orleans full scarce six thousand troop three twenty thousand french round encompassed set upon leisure enrank men wanted pikes set archers instead whereof sharp stakes pluckd hedges pitched ground confusedly keep horsemen breaking three hours fight continued valiant talbot human thought enacted wonders reenter bastard orleans joan la pucelle
reignier fair maid thou wilt wondrous feats pucelle reignier thou thinkest beguile dauphin come come behind know thee well though never seen amazd theres nothing hid private talk thee apart stand back lords give us leave awhile reignier takes upon bravely first dash pucelle dauphin birth shepherds daughter wit untraind kind art heaven lady gracious hath pleasd shine contemptible estate lo whilst waited tender lambs suns parching heat displayd cheeks gods mother deigned appear vision full majesty willd leave base vocation free country calamity aid promisd assurd success complete glory reveald whereas black swart clear rays infusd beauty blessd may see ask question thou canst possible answer unpremeditated courage try combat thou darst thou shalt find exceed sex resolve thou shalt fortunate thou receive thy warlike mate charles thou hast astonishd thy high terms proof ill thy valour make single combat thou shalt buckle thou vanquishest thy words true otherwise renounce confidence pucelle prepard keenedgd sword deckd five flowerdeluces side touraine saint katherines churchyard great deal old iron chose forth charles come gods name fear woman pucelle live ill neer fly man fight joan la pucelle overcomes charles stay stay thy hands thou art amazon fightest sword deborah pucelle christs mother helps else weak charles whoeer helps thee tis thou must help impatiently burn thy desire heart hands thou hast subdud excellent pucelle thy name let thy servant sovereign tis french dauphin sueth thee thus pucelle must yield rites love professions sacred chased thy foes hence think upon recompense charles meantime look gracious thy prostrate thrall reignier lord methinks long talk alencon doubtless shrives woman smock else neer could long protract speech reignier shall disturb since keeps mean alencon may mean poor men know women shrewd tempters tongues reignier lord devise shall give oer orleans pucelle say distrustful recreants fight till last gasp guard charles says ill confirm well fight pucelle assignd english scourge night siege assuredly ill raise expect saint martins summer halcyon days since entered wars glory like circle water never ceaseth enlarge till broad spreading disperse nought henrys death english circle ends dispersed glories included like proud insulting ship caesar fortune bare charles mahomet inspired dove thou eagle art inspired helen mother great constantine yet saint philips daughters like thee bright star venus falln earth may reverently worship thee enough alencon leave delays let us raise siege reignier woman thou canst save honours drive orleans immortalizd charles presently well try come lets away prophet trust prove false exeunt

enter mortimer brought chair gaolers
mortimer kind keepers weak decaying age let dying mortimer rest even like man new haled rack fare limbs long imprisonment grey locks pursuivants death nestorlike aged age care argue end edmund mortimer eyes like lamps whose wasting oil spent wax dim drawing exigent weak shoulders overborne burdening grief pithless arms like withered vine droops sapless branches ground yet feet whose strengthless stay numb unable support lump clay swiftwinged desire get grave witting comfort tell keeper nephew come first keeper richard plantagenet lord come sent unto temple unto chamber answer returnd come mortimer enough soul shall satisfied poor gentleman wrong doth equal mine since henry monmouth first began reign whose glory great arms loathsome sequestration even since hath richard obscurd deprivd honour inheritance arbitrator despairs death kind umpire mens miseries sweet enlargement doth dismiss hence would troubles likewise expird might recover lost
first keeper lord loving nephew come mortimer richard plantagenet friend come plantagenet ay noble uncle thus ignobly usd nephew late despised richard comes mortimer direct mine arms may embrace neck bosom spend latter gasp tell lips touch cheeks may kindly give one fainting kiss declare sweet stem yorks great stock didst thou say late thou wert despisd plantagenet first lean thine aged back mine arm ease ill tell thee disease day argument upon case words grew twixt somerset among terms usd lavish tongue upbraid fathers death obloquy set bars tongue else like requited therefore good uncle heir begotten body next birth parentage mother derived lionel duke clarence third son king edward third whereas john gaunt doth bring pedigree fourth heroic line mark haughty great attempt laboured plant rightful heir lost liberty lives long henry fifth succeeding father bolingbroke reign thy father earl cambridge derivd famous edmund langley duke york marrying sister thy mother pity hard distress levied army weening redeem installd diadem rest fell noble earl beheaded thus mortimers title rested suppressd plantagenet lord honour last mortimer true thou seest issue fainting words warrant death thou art heir rest wish thee gather yet wary thy studious care plantagenet thy grave admonishments prevail yet methinks fathers execution nothing less bloody tyranny mortimer silence nephew thou politic strong fixed house lancaster like mountain removd thy uncle removing hence princes courts cloyd long continuance settled place plantagenet uncle would part young years might redeem passage age mortimer thou dost wrong slaughterer doth giveth many wounds one kill mourn except thou sorrow good give order funeral farewell fair thy hopes prosperous thy life peace war dies plantagenet peace war befall thy parting soul prison hast thou spent pilgrimage like hermit overpassd thy days well lock counsel breast imagine let rest keepers convey hence see burial better life restored blood make ill th advantage good exit

act iii scene 1
london parliament house
flourish enter king exeter gloucester warwick somerset suffolk bishop winchester richard plantagenet others gloucester offers put bill winchester snatches tears
winchester comst thou deep premeditated lines written pamphlets studiously devisd humphrey gloucester thou canst accuse aught intendst lay unto charge without invention suddenly sudden extemporal speech purpose answer thou canst object gloucester presumptuous priest place commands patience thou shouldst find thou hast dishonourd think although writing preferrd manner thy vile outrageous crimes therefore forgd able verbatim rehearse method pen prelate thy audacious wickedness thy lewd pestiferous dissentious pranks infants prattle thy pride thou art pernicious usurer froward nature enemy peace lascivious wanton well beseems man thy profession degree thy treachery whats manifest thou laidst trap take life well london bridge tower beside fear thy thoughts sifted king thy sovereign quite exempt envious malice thy swelling heart winchester gloucester defy thee lords vouchsafe give hearing shall reply covetous ambitious perverse poor haps seek advance raise keep wonted calling dissension preferreth peace except provokd good lords offends incensd hath incensd duke one sway one king engenders thunder breast makes roar accusations forth shall know good gloucester good thou bastard grandfather winchester ay lordly sir pray one imperious anothers throne gloucester protector saucy priest winchester prelate church gloucester yes outlaw castle keeps useth patronage theft winchester unreverent gloucester gloucester thou art reverend touching thy spiritual function thy life winchester rome shall remedy warwick roam thither somerset lord duty forbear warwick ay see bishop overborne somerset methinks lord religious know office belongs warwick methinks lordship humbler fitteth prelate plead somerset yes holy state touchd near warwick state holy unhallowd grace protector king plantagenet aside plantagenet see must hold tongue lest said speak sirrah must bold verdict enter talk lords else would fling winchester king henry uncles gloucester winchester special suffolk thou wilt thou art prisoner gazes fairest beauty fear fly touch thee reverent hands kiss fingers eternal peace lay gently thy tender side art thou say may honour thee margaret margaret name daughter king king napleswhosoeer thou art suffolk earl suffolk calld offended natures miracle thou art allotted taen doth swan downy cygnets save keeping prisoner underneath wings yet servile usage offend go free suffolks friend going stay aside power let pass hand would free heart says plays sun upon glassy streams twinkling another counterfeited beam seems gorgeous beauty mine eyes fain would woo yet dare speak ill call pen ink write mind fie de la pole disable thyself hast tongue thy prisoner wilt thou daunted womans sight ay beautys princely majesty confounds tongue makes senses rough margaret say earl suffolk thy name ransom must pay pass perceive thy prisoner suffolk aside canst thou tell deny thy suit thou make trial love margaret speakst thou ransom must pay suffolk aside shes beautiful therefore wood woman therefore margaret wilt thou accept ransomyea suffolk aside fond man remember thou hast wife margaret thy paramour margaret best leave hear suffolk aside marrd lies cooling card margaret talks random sure man mad suffolk aside yet dispensation may margaret yet would would answer suffolk aside ill win lady margaret king tush thats wooden thing margaret talks wood carpenter suffolk aside yet fancy may satisfied peace established realms remains scruple though father king naples duke anjou maine yet poor nobility scorn match margaret hear ye captainare leisure suffolk aside shall disdain neer much henry youthful quickly yield madam secret reveal margaret aside though enthralld seems knight way dishonour suffolk lady vouchsafe listen say margaret aside enter duke wife eleanor

enter king salisbury warwick cardinal bed

act iv scene coast kent
alarum fight sea ordnance goes enter lieutenant shipmaster mate walter whitmore sailors suffolk gentlemen prisoners

contagious darkness air therefore bring forth soldiers prize whilst pinnace anchors downs shall make ransom sand blood stain discoloured shore master prisoner freely give thee thou art mate make boot walter whitmore thy share first gentleman ransom master let know master thousand crowns else lay head mate much shall give goes lieutenant think much pay two thousand crowns bear name port gentlemen cut villains throats die shall lives lost fight counterpoisd petty sum first gentleman ill give sir therefore spare life second gentleman write home straight whitmore lost mine eye laying prize aboard suffolk therefore revenge shalt thou die might lieutenant rash take ransom let live suffolk look george gentleman rate thou wilt thou shalt paid whitmore name walter whitmore startst thou doth death affright suffolk thy name affrights whose sound death cunning man calculate birth told water die yet let make thee bloodyminded thy name gualtier rightly sounded whitmore gualtier walter care never tongue whitmore speak captain shall stab forlorn swain lieutenant first let words stab hath suffolk base slave thy words blunt art thou lieutenant convey hence longboats side strike head suffolk thou darst thy lieutenant poole suffolk poole lieutenant ay kennel puddle sink whose filth dirt troubles silver spring england drinks dam thy yawning mouth swallowing treasure realm thy lips kissd queen shall sweep ground thou smildst good duke humphreys death senseless winds shalt grin vain contempt shall hiss thee wedded thou hags hell daring affy mighty lord unto daughter worthless king neither thy shoulder build seat never undertake thing wherein thy counsel consent wanting richard create thee duke gloucester george clarence warwick ourself shall undo pleaseth best richard let duke clarence george gloucester gloucesters dukedom ominous warwick tut thats foolish observation richard duke gloucester london see honours possession exeunt

act iii scene chase north england
enter two keepers crossbows hands
first keeper thickgrown brake well shroud laund anon deer come covert make stand culling principal deer second keeper ill stay hill may shoot first keeper noise thy crossbow scare herd shoot lost stand aim best time shall seem tedious ill tell thee befell day selfplace mean stand second keeper comes man lets stay till past
enter king henry disguised prayerbook
king henry scotland stoln even pure love greet mine land wishful sight harry harry tis land thine thy place filld thy sceptre wrung thee thy balm washd wherewith thou wast anointed bending knee call thee caesar humble suitors press speak right man comes redress thee help first keeper ay heres deer whose skins keepers fee quondam king lets seize upon king henry let embrace thee sour adversity wise men say wisest course second keeper linger let us lay hands upon first keeper forbear awhile well hear little king henry queen son gone france aid hear great commanding warwick thither gone crave french kings sister wife edward news true poor queen son labour lost warwick subtle orator lewis prince soon moving words account margaret may win shes woman pitied much sighs make battry breast tears edwards place margaret thus twill thou poor soul art forsaken thou wentst forlorn second keeper say art thou talkst kings queens king henry seem less born man least less men may talk kings second keeper ay thou talkst thou wert king king henry mind thats enough second keeper thou king thy crown king henry crown heart head deckd diamonds indian stones seen crown calld content crown seldom kings enjoy second keeper well king crownd content crown content must contented go along us think king king edward hath deposd subjects sworn allegiance apprehend enemy king henry never swear break oath second keeper never oath king henry dwell king england second keeper country remain king henry anointed king nine months old father grandfather kings sworn true subjects unto tell broke oaths first scene ii london palace
king edward brother gloucester saint albans field ladys husband sir richard grey slain land seizd conqueror suit repossess lands justice well deny quarrel house york worthy gentleman lose life gloucester highness shall well grant suit dishonour deny king edward less yet ill make pause gloucester aside clarence yea see lady hath thing grant king grant humble suit clarence aside gloucester knows game true keeps wind gloucester aside clarence silence king edward widow consider suit come time know mind lady grey right gracious lord brook delay may please highness resolve pleasure shall satisfy gloucester aside ay widow ill warrant lands pleases shall pleasure fight closer good faith youll catch blow clarence aside gloucester fear unless chance fall gloucester aside clarence god forbid hell take vantages king edward many children hast thou widow tell clarence aside gloucester think means beg child gloucester aside clarence nay whip hell rather give two lady grey three gracious lord gloucester aside shall four youll ruld king edward twere pity lose fathers lands lady grey pitiful dread lord grant king edward lords give us leave ill try widows wit gloucester aside ay good leave leave till youth take leave leave crutch gloucester clarence withdraw king edward tell madam love children lady grey ay full dearly love king edward would much good lady grey good would sustain harm king edward get husbands lands good lady grey therefore came unto majesty king edward ill tell lands got lady grey shall bind highness service king edward service wilt thou give lady grey command rests king edward take exceptions boon lady grey gracious lord except king edward ay thou canst mean ask lady grey grace commands gloucester plies hard much rain wears marble clarence red fire nay wax must melt lady grey stops lord shall hear task king edward easy task tis love king lady grey thats soon performd subject king edward thy husbands lands freely give thee lady grey take leave many thousand thanks gloucester match made seals curtsy king edward stay thee tis fruits love mean lady grey fruits love mean loving liege king edward ay fear another sense love thinkst thou sue much get lady grey love till death humble thanks prayers love virtue begs virtue grants king edward troth mean love lady grey mean thought king edward partly may perceive mind lady grey mind never grant perceive highness aims aim aright king edward tell thee plain aim lie thee lady grey tell plain rather lie prison king edward thou shalt thy husbands lands lady grey mine honesty shall dower loss purchase king edward therein thou wrongst thy children mightily lady grey herein highness wrongs mighty lord merry inclination accords sadness suit please dismiss either ay king edward ay thou wilt say ay request thou dost say demand lady grey lord suit end gloucester widow likes knits brows clarence bluntest wooer christendom king edward aside looks doth argue replete modesty words doth show wit incomparable perfections challenge sovereignty one way king shall love else queen say king edward take thee queen lady grey tis better said done gracious lord subject fit jest withal far unfit sovereign king edward sweet widow state swear thee speak soul intends enjoy thee love lady grey yield unto know mean queen yet good concubine king edward cavil widow mean queen lady grey twill grieve grace sons call father king edwardno daughters call thee mother thou art widow thou hast children gods mother bachelor tis happy thing father unto many sons answer thou shalt queen gloucester ghostly father hath done shrift clarence made shriver twas shrift king edward brothers muse chat two gloucester widow likes looks sad king edward youd think strange marry clarence lord king edward clarence scene iii france kings palace
flourish enter lewis french king sister bona admiral calld bourbon prince edward queen margaret earl oxford lewis sits riseth
lewis fair queen england worthy margaret sit us ill befits thy state birth thou shouldst stand lewis doth sit queen margaret mighty king france margaret must strike sail learn serve kings command must confess great albions queen former golden days mischance hath trod title dishonour laid ground must take like seat unto fortune humble seat conform lewis say fair queen whence springs deep despair queen margaret cause fills mine eyes tears stops tongue heart drownd cares lewis whateer thou still like thyself sit thee side seats yield thy neck fortunes yoke let thy dauntless mind still ride triumph mischance plain queen margaret tell thy grief shall easd france yield relief queen margaret gracious words revive drooping thoughts give tonguetied sorrows leave speak therefore known noble lewis henry sole possessor love king become banishd man forcd live scotland forlorn proud ambitious edward duke york usurps regal title seat englands trueanointed lawful king cause poor margaret son prince edward henrys heir come crave thy lawful aid thou fail us hope done scotland hath help help people peers misled treasure seizd soldiers put flight thou seest heavy plight lewis renowned queen patience calm storm bethink means break queen margaret stay stronger grows foe lewis stay ill succour thee queen margaret impatience waiteth true sorrow see comes breeder sorrow
lewis whats approacheth boldly presence queen margaret earl warwick edwards greatest friend lewis welcome brave warwick brings thee france descends ariseth queen margaret ay begins second storm rise moves wind tide warwick worthy edward king albion lord sovereign thy vowed friend come kindness unfeigned love first greetings thy royal person crave league amity lastly confirm amity nuptial knot thou vouchsafe grant virtuous lady bona thy fair sister englands king lawful marriage queen margaret aside go forward henrys hope done warwick bona gracious madam kings behalf commanded leave favour humbly kiss hand tongue tell passion sovereigns heart fame late entring heedful ears hath placd thy beautys image thy virtue queen margaret king lewis lady bona hear speak answer warwick demand springs edwards wellmeant honest love deceit bred necessity tyrants safely govern home unless abroad purchase great alliance prove tyrant reason may suffice henry liveth still dead yet prince edward stands king henrys son look therefore lewis league marriage thou draw thy danger dishonour though usurpers sway rule yet heavns time suppresseth wrongs warwick injurious margaret prince wales queen warwick thy father henry usurp thou art prince queen oxford warwick disannuls great john gaunt subdue greatest part spain john gaunt henry fourth whose wisdom mirror wisest wise prince henry fifth prowess conquered france henry lineally descends warwick oxford haps smooth discourse told henry sixth hath lost henry fifth gotten methinks peers france smile rest tell pedigree threescore two years silly time make prescription kingdoms worth oxford warwick canst thou speak thy liege thou obeyedst thirty six years betray thy treason blush warwick oxford ever fence right buckler falsehood pedigree land coast force tyrant seat war tis newmade bride shall succour clarence letters tell hes likely fall matching wanton lust honour strength safety country bona dear brother shall bona revengd thy help distressed queen queen margaret renowned prince shall poor henry live unless thou rescue foul despair bona quarrel english queens one warwick mine fair lady bona joins lewis mine thine margarets done wrong therefore ill uncrown eret long theres thy reward gone exit post lewis warwick thou oxford five thousand men shall cross seas bid false edward battle occasion serves noble queen prince shall follow fresh supply yet ere thou go answer one doubt pledge thy firm loyalty warwick shall assure constant loyalty queen young prince agree ill join mine eldest daughter joy forthwith holy wedlock bands queen margaret yes agree thank motion son edward fair virtuous therefore delay give thy hand warwick thy hand thy faith irrevocable warwicks daughter shall thine prince wales yes accept well deserves pledge vow give hand gives hand warwick lewis stay soldiers shall levied thou lord bourbon high admiral shall waft royal fleet long till edward fall wars mischance mocking marriage dame enter three watchmen guard kings tent

king edward go trumpet walls sound parle gloucester see surly warwick mans wall warwick unbid spite sportful edward come slept scouts seducd could hear news repair king edward warwick wilt thou ope city gates speak gentle words humbly bend thy knee call edward king hands beg mercy shall pardon thee outrages warwick nay rather wilt thou draw thy forces hence confess set thee pluckd thee call warwick patron penitent thou shalt still remain duke york gloucester thought least would said king make jest warwick dukedom sir goodly gift gloucester ay faith poor earl give ill thee service good gift warwick twas gave kingdom thy brother king edward tis mine warwicks gift warwick thou art atlas great weight weakling warwick takes gift henry king warwick subject king edward warwicks king edwards prisoner gallant warwick answer body head gloucester alas warwick forecast whiles thought steal single ten king slily fingerd deck left poor henry bishops palace ten one youll meet tower king edward tis even yet warwick still gloucester come warwick take time kneel kneel nay strike else iron cools warwick rather chop hand blow fling thy face bear low sail strike thee king edward sail thou canst wind tide thy friend hand fast wound thy coalblack hair shall whiles thy head warm new cut write dust sentence thy blood windchanging warwick change

enter king henry gloucester lieutenant walls

us must confer exit lieutenant king henry flies reckless shepherd wolf first harmless sheep doth yield fleece next throat unto butchers knife scene death hath roscius act gloucester suspicion always haunts guilty mind thief doth fear bush officer king henry bird hath limed bush trembling wings misdoubteth every bush hapless male one sweet bird fatal object eye poor young limd caught killd whose envious gulf swallow life ah kill thy weapon words breast better brook thy daggers point ears tragic history wherefore dost thou come ist life gloucester thinkst thou executioner king henry persecutor sure thou art murdering innocents executing thou executioner gloucester thy son killd presumption king henry hadst thou killd first thou didst presume thou hadst livd kill son mine thus prophesy many thousand mistrust parcel fear many old mans sigh many widows many orphans waterstanding eye men sons wives husbands orphans parents timeless death shall rue hour ever thou wast born owl shriekd thy birth evil sign nightcrow cried aboding luckless time dogs howld hideous tempest shook trees raven rookd chimneys top chattring pies dismal discords sung thy mother felt mothers pain yet die prophet thy speech stabs amongst rest ordaind king henry ay much slaughter god forgive sins pardon thee dies gloucester aspiring blood lancaster sink ground thought would mounted see sword weeps came world legs forward reason think ye make haste seek ruin usurpd right midwife wonderd women cried jesus bless us born teeth plainly signified snarl bite play dog since heavens shapd body let hell open queen going chapel voice coronation wolsey weight pulld cromwell king gone beyond glories one woman lost ever sun shall ever usher forth mine honours gild noble troops waited upon smiles go get thee cromwell poor falln man unworthy thy lord master seek king sun pray may never set told true thou art advance thee little memory stir know noble naturenot let thy hopeful service perish good cromwell neglect make use provide thine future safety cromwell lord must leave must needs forgo good noble true master bear witness hearts iron sorrow cromwell leaves lord king shall service prayers ever ever shall wolsey cromwell think shed tear miseries thou hast forcd thy honest truth play woman lets dry eyes thus far hear cromwell forgotten shall sleep dull cold marble mention must heard say taught thee say wolsey trod ways glory sounded depths shoals honour found thee way wreck rise sure safe one though thy master missd mark fall ruind cromwell charge thee fling away ambition sin fell angels man image maker hope win love thyself last cherish hearts hate thee corruption wins honesty still thy right hand carry gentle peace silence envious tongues fear let ends thou aimst thy countrys thy gods truths thou fallst cromwell thou fallst blessed martyr serve king andprithee lead take inventory last penny tis kings robe integrity heaven dare call mine cromwell cromwell servd god half zeal servd king would mine age left naked mine enemies cromwell good sir patience wolsey farewell hopes court hopes heaven dwell exeunt

enter katharine dowager sick led griffith gentleman usher patience woman

eightwhich foretold lastfull repentance continual meditations tears sorrows gave honours world blessed part heaven slept peace katharine may rest faults lie gently yet thus far griffith give leave speak yet charity man unbounded stomach ever ranking princes one suggestion tied kingdom simony fair play opinion law th presence would say untruths ever double words meaning never meant ruin pitiful elizabeth king stand lord king kisses child kiss take blessing god protect thee whose hand give thy life cranmer amen king noble gossips yhave prodigal thank ye heartily shall lady much english cranmer let speak sir heaven bids words utter let none think flattery theyll find em truth royal infantheaven still move though cradle yet promises upon land thousand blessings time shall bring ripeness shall living behold goodness pattern princes living shall succeed saba never covetous wisdom fair virtue pure soul shall princely graces mould mighty piece virtues attend good shall still doubled truth shall nurse holy heavenly thoughts still counsel shall lovd feard shall bless foes shake like field beaten corn hang heads sorrow good grows days every man shall eat safety vine plants sing merry songs peace neighbours god shall truly known shall read perfect ways honour claim greatness blood shall peace sleep bird wonder dies maiden phoenix ashes new create another heir great admiration shall leave blessedness one heaven shall call cloud darkness sacred ashes honour shall starlike rise great fame stand fixd peace plenty love truth terror servants chosen infant shall like vine grow wherever bright sun heaven shall shine honour greatness name shall make new nations shall flourish like mountain cedar reach branches plains childrens children shall see bless heaven king thou speakest wonders cranmer shall happiness england aged princess many days shall see yet day without deed crown would known must die must saints must heryet virgin unspotted lily shall pass th ground world shall mourn king lord archbishop thou hast made man never happy child get anything oracle comfort pleasd heaven shall desire see child praise maker thank ye good lord mayor good brethren act scene 1
enter king john queen elinor pembroke essex salisbury others chatillon

enter robert faulconbridge philip bastard brother
men bastard faithful subject gentleman born northamptonshire eldest son suppose robert faulconbridge soldier honourgiving hand coeurdelion knighted field king john art thou robert son heir may elinor thee rude man thou dost shame thy mother wound honour diffidence bastard madam reason brothers plea none mine prove pops least fair five hundred pound year heaven guard mothers honour land dispossess sir get think elinor whether hadst thou rather faulconbridge like thy brother enjoy thy land reputed son coeurdelion lord thy presence land beside bastard madam brother shape sir roberts like legs two ridingrods arms eelskins stuffd face thin mine ear durst stick rose lest men say look threefarthings goes shape heir land would might never stir place would give every foot face would sir nob case elinor like thee well wilt thou forsake thy fortune bequeath thy land follow soldier bound france bastard brother take land ill take chance face hath got five hundred pound year yet sell face fivepence tis dear madam ill follow unto death elinor nay would go thither bastard country manners give betters way king john thy name bastard philip liege name begun philip good old sir roberts enter flavius marullus certain commoners
flavius hence home idle creatures get home holiday know mechanical ought walk upon laboring day without sign profession speak trade art thou first commoner sir carpenter marullus thy leather apron thy rule dost thou thy best apparel sir trade second commoner truly sir respect fine workman would say cobbler marullus trade art thou answer directly second commoner trade sir hope may use safe conscience indeed sir mender bad soles marullus trade thou knave thou naughty knave trade second commoner nay beseech sir yet sir mend marullus meanst thou mend thou saucy fellow second commoner sir cobble flavius thou art cobbler art thou second commoner truly sir live awl meddle tradesmans matters womens matters awl indeed sir surgeon old shoes great danger recover proper men ever trod upon neats leather gone upon handiwork flavius wherefore art thy shop today dost thou lead men streets second commoner truly sir wear shoes get work indeed sir make holiday see caesar rejoice triumph worth simplicity
princess france comes boyet mirth face boyet stabbd laughter wheres grace princess france thy news boyet boyet prepare madam prepare arm wenches arm encounters mounted peace love doth approach page well heart hath connd embassage action accent teach thus must thou speak thus thy body bear ever anon made doubt presence majestical would put quoth king angel shalt thou see yet fear thou speak come third caperd cried goes well fourth turnd toe fell tumble ground zealous laughter profound spleen ridiculous appears check folly passions solemn tears princess france come visit us boyet isabella speak indirectly loath would say truth accuse part yet advisd says veil full purpose mariana ruld isabella besides tells peradventure speak adverse side think strange tis physic thats bitter sweet end mariana would friar peter
isabella peace friar come peter come found stand fit may vantage duke shall pass twice trumpets sounded generous gravest citizens hent gates near upon duke entring therefore hence away exeunt

scene ii belmont portias house
enter portia waitingwoman nerissa

enter bassanio shylock jew

act iv scene venice court justice
enter duke magnificoes antonio bassanio gratiano salerio others

duke venice make room let stand face shylock world thinks think thou leadest fashion thy malice last hour act tis thought thoult show thy mercy remorse strange thy strange apparent cruelty thou exacts penalty pound poor merchants flesh thou wilt loose forfeiture touchd human gentleness love forgive moiety principal glancing eye pity losses late huddled back enow press royal merchant pluck commiseration state brassy bosoms rough hearts flint stubborn turks tartars never traind offices tender courtesy expect gentle answer jew shylock possessd grace purpose holy sabbath sworn due forfeit thousand ducats band answerd yet men love gaping pig mad behold cat others bagpipe sings th nose contain urine affection mistress passion sways mood likes loathes answer firm reason rendred abide gaping pig harmless necessary cat woollen bagpipe force must yield inevitable shame offend offended give reason lodgd hate certain loathing bear antonio follow thus losing suit answered bassanio answer thou unfeeling man excuse current thy cruelty shylock bound please thee answers bassanio men kill things love shylock hates man thing would kill bassanio every offence hate first shylock wouldst thou serpent sting thee twice antonio pray think question jew may well go stand upon beach bid main flood bate usual height may well use question wolf hath made ewe bleat lamb may well forbid enthroned hearts kings attribute god earthly power doth show likest gods mercy seasons justice therefore jew though justice thy plea consider course justice none us see salvation pray mercy prayer doth teach us render deeds mercy spoke thus much mitigate justice thy plea thou follow strict court venice must needs give sentence gainst merchant shylock deeds upon head crave law penalty forfeit bond bassanio yes tender court yea twice sum suffice bound pay ten times oer forfeit hands head heart suffice must appear malice bears truth beseech wrest law authority great right little wrong curb cruel devil portia must power venice alter decree established twill recorded precedent many error example rush state shylock daniel come judgment yea daniel wise young judge honour thee portia pray let look upon bond shylock tis reverend doctor portia shylock theres thrice thy money offred thee shylock oath oath oath heaven shall lay perjury upon soul venice portia bond forfeit lawfully jew may claim pound flesh cut nearest merchants heart merciful take thrice thy money bid tear bond shylock paid according tenour doth appear worthy judge know law exposition hath sound charge law whereof welldeserving pillar proceed judgment soul swear power tongue man alter stay bond antonio heartily beseech court give judgment portia thus must prepare bosom knife shylock noble judge excellent young man portia intent purpose law hath full relation penalty appeareth due upon bond shylock tis true wise upright judge much elder art thou thy looks portia therefore lay bare bosom shylock ay breast says bond doth noble judge nearest heart words portia balance weigh flesh shylock ready portia surgeon shylock charge stop wounds lest bleed death shylock nominated bond portia expressd twere good oberon ill met moonlight proud titania titania jealous oberon fairies skip hence forsworn bed company oberon tarry rash wanton thy lord titania must thy lady know thou hast stolen away fairy land shape corin sat day playing pipes corn versing love amorous phillida art thou come farthest steep india forsooth bouncing amazon buskind mistress warrior love theseus must wedded come give bed joy prosperity oberon canst thou thus shame titania glance credit hippolyta knowing know thy love theseus didst thou lead glimmering night perigouna ravished make fair aegles break faith ariadne antiopa titania forgeries jealousy never since middle summers spring met hill dale forest mead paved fountain rushy brook beached margent sea dance ringlets whistling wind thy brawls thou hast disturbd sport therefore winds piping us vain revenge suckd sea contagious fogs falling land hath every pelting river made proud overborne continents ox hath therefore stretchd yoke vain ploughman lost sweat green corn hath rotted ere youth attaind beard fold stands empty drowned field crows fatted murrion flock nine mens morris filld mud quaint mazes wanton green lack tread undistinguishable human mortals want winter night hymn carol blest therefore moon governess floods pale anger washes air rheumatic diseases abound thorough distemperature see seasons alter hoaryheaded frosts fall fresh lap crimson rose old hiems thin icy crown odorous chaplet sweet summer buds mockery set spring summer childing autumn angry winter change wonted liveries mazed world increase knows progeny evils comes debate dissension parents original oberon amend lies titania cross oberon beg little changeling boy henchman titania set heart rest fairy land buys child mother votress order spiced indian air night full often hath gossipd side sat neptunes yellow sands marking th embarked traders flood laughd see sails conceive grow bigbellied wanton wind pretty swimming gait following womb rich young squire would imitate sail upon land fetch trifles return voyage rich merchandise mortal boy die sake rear boy sake part oberon long within wood intend stay titania perchance till theseus weddingday patiently dance aftersupper bedtime usual manager mirth revels hand play ease anguish torturing hour call philostrate philostrate mighty theseus theseus say abridgment evening masque music shall beguile lazy time prologue gentles perchance wonder show wonder till truth make things plain man pyramus would know beauteous lady thisby certain man lime roughcast doth present wall vile wall lovers sunder walls chink poor souls content whisper let man wonder man lanthorn dog bush thorn presenteth moonshine know moonshine lovers think scorn meet ninus tomb woo grisly beast lion hight name trusty thisby coming first night scare away rather affright fled mantle fall lion vile bloody mouth stain anon comes pyramus sweet youth tall finds trusty thisbys mantle slain whereat blade bloody blameful blade bravely broachd boiling bloody breast thisby tarrying mulberry shade dagger drew died rest let lion moonshine wall lovers twain large discourse remain exeunt prologue pyramus thisby lion moonshine theseus wonder lion speak demetrius wonder lord one lion may many asses wall interlude doth befall one snout name present wall wall would think crannied hole chink lovers pyramus thisby whisper often secretly loam roughcast stone doth show wall truth cranny right sinister fearful lovers whisper theseus would desire lime hair speak better demetrius wittiest partition ever heard discourse lord
theseus pyramus draws near wall silence pyramus grimlookd night night hue black night ever art day night night alack alack alack fear thisbys promise forgot thou wall sweet lovely wall standst fathers ground mine thou wall wall sweet lovely wall show thy chink blink mine eyne wall holds fingers thanks courteous wall jove shield thee well see see thisby see wicked wall see bliss cursd thy stones thus deceiving theseus wall methinks sensible curse pyramus truth sir deceiving thisbys cue enter spy wall shall see fall pat told yonder comes
thisby wall full often hast thou beard moans parting fair pyramus cherry lips often kissd thy stones thy stones lime hair knit thee pyramus see voice chink spy hear thisbys face thisby thisby love thou art love think pyramus think thou wilt thy lovers grace like limander trusty still thisby like helen till fates kill pyramus shafalus procrus true thisby shafalus procrus pyramus kiss hole vile wall thisby kiss walls hole lips pyramus wilt thou ninnys tomb meet straightway thisby tide life tide death come without delay exeunt pyramus thisby wall thus wall part discharged done thus wall away doth go exit wall theseus moon used two neighbours demetrius remedy lord walls wilful hear without warning hippolyta silliest stuff ever heard theseus best kind shadows worst worse imagination amend hippolyta must imagination theseus imagine worse may pass excellent men come two noble beasts man lion

enter benedick margaret meeting

prove mowbray let cold words accuse zeal tis trial womans war bitter clamour two eager tongues arbitrate cause betwixt us twain blood hot must coold yet tame patience boast hushd nought say first fair reverence highness curbs giving reins spurs free speech else would post returnd terms treason doubled throat setting aside high bloods royalty let kinsman liege defy spit call slanderous coward villain maintain would allow odds meet tied run afoot even frozen ridges alps ground inhabitable ever englishman durst set foot meantime let defend loyalty hopes falsely doth lie bolingbroke pale else make good thee arm arm spoke thou canst worst devise mowbray take sword swear gently laid knighthood shoulder ill answer thee fair degree chivalrous design knightly trial mount alive may light traitor unjustly fight king richard doth cousin lay mowbrays charge must great inherit us much thought ill bolingbroke look speak life shall prove true mowbray hath receivd eight thousand nobles name lendings highness soldiers hath detaind lewd employments like false traitor injurious villain besides say battle prove elsewhere furthest verge ever surveyd english eye treasons eighteen years complotted contrived land fetch false mowbray first head spring say maintain upon bad life make good plot duke gloucesters death suggest soonbelieving adversaries consequently like traitor coward sluicd innocent soul streams blood blood like sacrificing abels cries even tongueless caverns earth justice rough chastisement glorious worth descent arm shall life spent king richard high pitch resolution soars thomas norfolk sayst thou mowbray let sovereign turn away face bid ears little deaf till told slander blood god good men hate foul liar king richard mowbray impartial eyes cars fearless thee allow mowbray bolingbroke low thy heart false passage thy throat thou liest three parts receipt calais disbursd duly highness soldiers part reservd consent sovereign liege debt upon enter earl salisbury welsh captain

king richard barkloughly castle hand aumerle yea lord brooks grace air late tossing breaking seas king richard needs must like well weep joy stand upon kingdom dear earth salute thee hand though rebels wound thee horses hoofs longparted mother child plays fondly tears smiles meeting weepingsmiling greet thee earth thee favours royal hands feed thy sovereigns foe gentle earth thy sweets comfort ravenous sense let thy spiders suck thy venom heavygaited toads lie way annoyance treacherous feet usurping steps trample thee yield stinging nettles mine enemies thy bosom pluck flower guard pray thee lurking adder whose double tongue may mortal touch throw death upon thy sovereigns enemies mock senseless conjuration lords earth shall feeling stones prove armed soldiers ere native king shall falter foul rebellions arms carlisle fear lord power made king hath power keep king spite means heaven yields must embracd neglected else heaven would heavens offer refuse proffered means succour redress aumerle means lord remiss whilst bolingbroke security grows strong great substance power king richard discomfortable cousin knowst thou searching eye heaven hid behind globe lights lower world thieves robbers range abroad unseen murders outrage boldly terrestrial ball fires proud tops eastern pines darts light every guilty hole murders treasons detested sins cloak night pluckd backs stand bare naked trembling thief traitor bolingbroke hath revelld night whilst wandring antipodes shall see us rising throne east treasons sit blushing face able endure sight day selfaffrighted tremble sin water rough rude sea wash balm anointed king breath worldly men depose deputy elected lord every man bolingbroke hath pressd lift shrewd steel golden crown god richard hath heavenly pay glorious angel angels fight weak men must fall heaven still guards right

enter duke york duchess

enter bolingbroke king percy lords

aumerle king bolingbroke means cousin stares looks wildly aumerle god save grace beseech majesty conference grace alone bolingbroke withdraw leave us alone exeunt percy lords matter cousin aumerle ever may knees grow earth kneels tongue cleave roof within mouth unless pardon ere rise speak bolingbroke intended committed fault first heinous eer win thy afterlove pardon thee aumerle give leave may turn key man enter till tale done bolingbroke thy desire duke york knocks door crieth york within liege beware look thyself thou hast traitor thy presence bolingbroke drawing villain ill make thee safe aumerle stay thy revengeful hand thou hast cause fear york within open door secure foolhardy king shall love speak treason thy face open door break open

duchess king believe hardhearted man love loving none york thou frantic woman dost thou make shall thy old dugs traitor rear duchess sweet york patient hear gentle liege kneels bolingbroke rise good aunt duchess yet thee beseech ever walk upon knees never see day happy sees till thou give joy thou bid joy pardoning rutland transgressing boy aumerle unto mothers prayers bend knee kneels york true joints bended kneels ill mayst thou thrive thou grant grace duchess pleads earnest look upon face eyes drop tears prayers jest words come mouth breast prays faintly would denied pray heart soul beside weary joints would gladly rise know knees still kneel till ground grow prayers full false hypocrisy true zeal deep integrity prayers outpray let mercy true prayer ought bolingbroke good aunt stand duchess say stand say pardon first afterwards stand thy nurse thy tongue teach pardon first word thy speech never longd hear word till say pardon king let pity teach thee word short short sweet word like pardon kings mouths meet york speak french king say pardonne moy duchess dost thou teach pardon pardon destroy ah sour husband hardhearted lord sets word word speak pardon tis current land chopping french understand thine eye begins speak set thy tongue thy piteous heart plant thou thine ear hearing plaints prayers pierce pity may move thee pardon rehearse bolingbroke good aunt stand duchess sue stand pardon suit hand bolingbroke pardon god shall pardon duchess happy vantage kneeling knee yet sick fear speak twice saying pardon doth pardon twain makes one pardon strong bolingbroke heart pardon duchess god earth thou art bolingbroke trusty brotherinlaw abbot rest consorted crew destruction straight shall dog heels good uncle help order several powers oxford whereer traitors shall live within world swear know uncle farewell cousin adieu mother well hath prayd prove true duchess come old son pray god make thee new exeunt
scene 4 windsor castle

act iv scene 1

act iii scene public place

enter friar laurence county paris

par happily met lady wife jul may sir may wife par may must love thursday next jul must shall friar thats certain text par come make confession father jul answer confess par deny love jul confess love par ye sure love jul price spoke behind back face par poor soul thy face much abusd tears jul tears got small victory bad enough spite par thou wrongst tears report jul slander sir truth spake spake face par thy face mine thou hast slandred jul may mine leisure holy father shall come evening mass friar leisure serves pensive daughter lord must entreat time alone par god shield disturb devotion juliet thursday early rouse ye till adieu keep holy kiss exit jul shut door thou hast done come weep past hope past cure past help friar ah juliet already know thy grief strains past compass wits hear thou must nothing may prorogue thursday next married county jul tell friar thou hearst unless thou tell may prevent thy wisdom thou canst give help thou call resolution wise knife ill help presently god joind heart romeos thou hands ere hand thee romeos seald shall label another deed true heart treacherous revolt turn another shall slay therefore thy longexperiencd time give present counsel behold twixt extremes bloody knife shall play empire arbitrating commission thy years art could issue true honour bring long speak long die thou speakst speak remedy friar hold daughter spy kind hope craves desperate execution desperate would prevent rather marry county paris thou hast strength slay thyself likely thou wilt undertake thing like death chide away shame copst death scape thou darst ill give thee remedy jul bid leap rather marry paris battlements yonder tower walk thievish ways bid lurk serpents chain roaring bears shut nightly charnel house oercoverd quite dead mens rattling bones reeky shanks yellow chapless skulls bid go newmade grave hide dead man shroud things hear told made tremble without fear doubt live unstaind wife sweet love friar hold go home merry give consent marry paris wednesday tomorrow tomorrow night look thou lie alone let nurse lie thee thy chamber take thou vial bed distilled liquor drink thou presently thy veins shall run cold drowsy humour pulse shall keep native progress surcease warmth breath shall testify thou livest roses thy lips cheeks shall fade paly ashes thy eyes windows fall like death shuts day life part deprivd supple government shall stiff stark cold appear like death borrowed likeness shrunk death thou shalt continue twoandforty hours awake pleasant sleep bridegroom morning comes rouse thee thy bed art thou dead manner country thy best robes uncovered bier thou shalt borne ancient vault kindred capulets lie mean time thou shalt awake shall romeo letters know drift hither shall come watch thy waking night shall romeo bear thee hence mantua shall free thee present shame inconstant toy womanish fear abate thy valour acting jul give give tell fear friar hold get gone strong prosperous resolve ill send friar speed mantua letters thy lord jul love give strength strength shall help afford farewell dear father exeunt

enter father capulet mother nurse servingmen two three

food romeo opens tomb par banishd haughty montague murdred loves cousin grief supposed fair creature died come villanous shame dead bodies apprehend stop thy unhallowed toil vile montague vengeance petruchio verona take leave see friends padua best beloved approved friend hortensio trow house sirrah grumio knock say grumio knock sir knock man rebusd worship petruchio villain say knock soundly grumio knock sir sir sir knock sir petruchio villain say knock gate rap well ill knock knaves pate grumio master grown quarrelsome knock first know comes worst petruchio faith sirrah youll knock ill ring ill try solfa sing wrings ears grumio help masters help master mad petruchio knock bid sirrah villain
hortensio whats matter old friend grumio good friend petruchio verona petruchio signior hortensio come part fray con tutto il cuore ben trovato may say hortensio alla nostra casa ben venuto molto honorato signor mio petruchio rise grumio rise compound quarrel grumio nay tis matter sir leges latin lawful cause leave service look sir bid knock rap soundly sir well fit servant use master perhaps aught see two thirty pip would god well knockd first grumio come worst petruchio senseless villain good hortensio bade rascal knock upon gate could get heart grumio knock gate heavens spake words plain sirrah knock rap knock well knock soundly come knocking gate petruchio sirrah gone talk advise hortensio petruchio patience grumios pledge thiss heavy chance twixt ancient trusty pleasant servant grumio tell sweet friend happy gale blows padua old verona petruchio wind scatters young men world seek fortunes farther home small experience grows signior hortensio thus stands antonio father deceasd thrust maze haply wive thrive best may crowns purse goods home come abroad see world hortensio petruchio shall come roundly thee wish thee shrewd illfavourd wife thoudst thank little counsel yet ill promise thee shall rich rich thart much friend ill wish thee petruchio signior hortensio twixt friends words suffice therefore thou know one rich enough petruchios wife wealth burden wooing dance foul florentius love old sibyl curst shrewd socrates xanthippe worse moves removes least affections edge rough swelling adriatic seas come wive wealthily padua wealthily happily padua grumio nay look sir tells flatly mind give gold enough marry puppet agletbaby old trot neer tooth head though many diseases two fifty horses nothing comes amiss money comes withal hortensio petruchio since steppd thus far continue broachd jest petruchio help thee wife wealth enough young beauteous brought best becomes gentlewoman fault faults enough intolerable curst shrewd froward beyond measure state far worser would wed mine gold petruchio hortensio peace thou knowst golds effect tell fathers name tis enough board though chide loud thunder clouds autumn crack hortensio father baptista minola affable courteous gentleman name katherina minola renownd padua scolding tongue petruchio know father though know knew deceased father well sleep hortensio till see therefore let thus bold give first encounter unless accompany thither grumio pray sir let go humour lasts word knew well would think scolding would little good upon may perhaps call half score knaves thats nothing begin hell rail ropetricks ill tell sir stand little throw figure face disfigure shall eyes see withal cat know sir hortensio tarry petruchio must go thee baptistas keep treasure hath jewel life hold youngest daughter beautiful bianca withholds suitors rivals love supposing thing impossible defects rehearsd ever katherina wood therefore order hath baptista taen none shall access unto bianca till katherine curst got husband grumio katherine curst title maid titles worst hortensio shall friend petruchio grace offer disguisd sober robes old baptista schoolmaster well seen music instruct bianca may device least leave leisure make love unsuspected court
enter gremio lucentio disguised cambio

agreement us liking undertake woo curst katherine yea marry dowry please gremio said done well hortensio told faults petruchio know irksome brawling scold masters hear harm gremio sayst friend countryman petruchio born verona old antonios son father dead fortune lives hope good days long see gremio sir life wife strange stomach tot gods name shall assisting woo wildcat petruchio live grumio enter tranio bravely apparelled lucentio biondello
tranio gentlemen god save may bold tell beseech readiest way house signior baptista minola biondello two fair daughters ist mean tranio even biondello gremio hark sir mean tranio perhaps sir petruchio chides sir hand pray tranio love chiders sir biondello lets away lucentio aside well begun tranio hortensio sir word ere go suitor maid talk yea tranio sir offence gremio without words get hence tranio sir pray streets free gremio

baptista friend dost thou look pale hortensio fear promise look pale baptista daughter prove good musician hortensio think shell sooner prove soldier iron may hold never lutes baptista thou canst break lute hortensio hath broke lute tell mistook frets bowd hand teach fingering impatient devilish spirit frets call quoth ill fume word struck head instrument pate made way stood amazed pillory looking lute call rascal fiddler twangling jack twenty vile terms studied misuse petruchio world lusty wench love ten times eer long chat baptista well go discomfited proceed practice younger daughter shes apt learn thankful good turns signior petruchio go us shall send daughter kate petruchio pray exeunt petruchio ill attend woo spirit comes say rail ill tell plain sings sweetly nightingale say frown ill say looks clear morning roses newly washd dew say mute speak word ill commend volubility say uttereth piercing eloquence bid pack ill give thanks though bid stay week deny wed ill crave day shall ask banns married comes lndnow petruchio speak
good morrow kate thats name hear katherina well heard something hard hearing call katherine talk petruchio lie faith calld plain kate bonny kate sometimes kate curst kate prettiest kate christendom kate kate hall superdainty kate dainties kates therefore kate take kate consolation hearing thy mildness praisd every town thy virtues spoke thy beauty sounded yet deeply thee belongs movd woo thee wife katherina movd good time let movd hither remove hence knew first moveable petruchio whats moveable katherina joindstool petruchio thou hast hit come sit katherina asses made bear petruchio women made bear katherina jade mean petruchio alas good kate burden thee knowing thee young light katherina light swain catch yet heavy weight petruchio buzz katherina well taen like buzzard petruchio slowwingd turtle shall buzzard take thee katherina ay turtle takes buzzard petruchio come come wasp faith angry katherina waspish best beware sting petruchio remedy pluck katherina ay fool could find lies petruchio knows wasp wear sting tail katherina tongue petruchio whose tongue katherina talk tales farewell petruchio tongue tail nay come good kate gentleman katherina ill try strikes petruchio swear ill cuff strike katherina may lose arms strike gentleman gentleman arms petruchio herald kate put thy books katherina crest coxcomb petruchio combless cock kate hen katherina cock mine crow like craven petruchio nay come kate come must look sour katherina fashion see crab petruchio heres crab therefore look sour katherina petruchio show katherina glass would petruchio mean face katherina well aimd young one petruchio saint george young katherina yet witherd petruchio tis cares katherina care petruchio nay hear kate sooth scape katherina chafe tarry let go petruchio whit find passing gentle twas told rough coy sullen find report liar thou art pleasant gamesome passing courteous slow speech yet sweet springtime flowers thou canst frown thou canst look askance bite lip angry wenches hast thou pleasure cross talk thou mildness entertainst thy wooers gentle conference soft affable world report kate doth limp slandrous world kate like hazeltwig straight slender brown hue hazelnuts sweeter kernels let see thee walk thou dost halt katherina go fool thou keepst command petruchio ever dian become grove kate chamber princely gait thou dian let kate let kate chaste dian sportful katherina study goodly speech petruchio extempore mother wit katherina witty mother witless else son petruchio wise katherina yes keep warm petruchio marry mean sweet katherine thy bed therefore setting chat aside thus plain terms father hath consented shall wife dowry greed nill marry kate husband turn light whereby see thy beauty thy beauty doth make like thee well thou must married man born tame kate bring wild kate kate conformable household kates
